docs.title: Benjamin "Ben" Small
docs.text: Sam Small's father, a Philadelphia city planner and civilian parent figure who provides measured support for his daughter's superhero activities while imposing boundaries rooted in deep personal concern.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Benjamin Small Aliases Gun Dad, Gun DILF (social media nickname) Date of Birth Unknown (born in the 1980s) Age 40s Gender Male Ethnicity Jewish-American Place of Birth New York City, New York Residence Mayfair, Philadelphia, PA Affiliation N/A (civilian) Former Affiliations N/A Occupation City Planner, City of Philadelphia Status Active First Appearance Chapter 1 (mentioned); Chapter 2 (on-page) Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Benjamin "Ben" Small grew up in New York City during the chaotic 1980s, a period before the organized superhero community had fully established itself. This upbringing instilled in him a pragmatic awareness of urban danger and self-reliance. His father, Morris "Pop-Pop Moe" Small, a civil engineer who co-founded Horvath-Small Ltd., taught Ben to shoot at age twenty-one, imparting a philosophy that power of any kind is neither good nor bad but depends entirely on when, why, and how it is used. This worldview was further shaped by the family's connection to the Holocaust — Ben's grandmother Leah was a survivor, and her experience informed Moe's conviction that ordinary people must sometimes be prepared to protect themselves when no hero is available.

In his younger years, Ben was a metalhead and leftist activist. He attended Drexel University in Philadelphia, where he met Rachel (nee de Leon), his future wife. At some point he had a physical altercation with Rachel's estranged father, Victor Blanc, which contributed to Victor's disconnection from the family. Ben eventually channeled his activist energy into systemic work, becoming a city planner focused on improving Philadelphia's zoning laws and urban infrastructure from within the system. He and Rachel settled in Mayfair, where they raised their daughter Samantha.

Ben's life changed dramatically when Sam gained shark-based powers after a boating accident in the summer of 2023. He and Rachel provided parental consent for Sam's provisional Juvenile License to Utilize Metahuman Abilities (JLUMA). From that point forward, Ben found himself navigating the impossible tension between wanting to protect his daughter and respecting her growing independence as a superhero. His home was destroyed by the Kingdom of Keys during an attack by Mr. T-Rex and Mrs. Z, though Ben had the foresight to carry "superhero insurance" on the property in addition to standard homeowner's coverage. The house was rebuilt, and the family returned to Mayfair, but the attack underscored the escalating consequences of Sam's double life.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file. Ben Small is a baseline human with no metahuman abilities.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text: N/A — Ben possesses no superpowers.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Baseline human durability, strength, and reflexes.
  • Sustained a gunshot wound during the South Street confrontation with Rush Order in July 2025, requiring surgery and an extended recovery period involving wheelchair use, then a cane, and eventually physical therapy.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Firearms Proficiency — Trained by Pop-Pop Moe at age twenty-one. Maintains a monthly practice routine at the Philadelphia Sportsmen's Association. Owns a Smith & Wesson M&P Shield, which he stores in a biometric safe with ammunition kept separately. His shooting stance resembles a boxing form, and he clusters shots near center target with consistent accuracy.
  • City Planning Expertise — Professional knowledge of Philadelphia's zoning, infrastructure, commercial corridors, sewer systems, and urban development patterns. This expertise has directly aided Sam's operations, including providing city planning maps, survey maps, infrastructure overlays, and sewer plans for the Mayfair, Tacony, and Northeast Philadelphia areas. He once corrected the Auditors' prediction model for Kingdom of Keys territorial expansion, identifying that the organization would follow commercial corridors rather than spreading radially.
  • Gun Safety Instruction — Taught Sam basic firearms safety principles from an early age: never touch, tell an adult, treat every firearm as loaded.
  • Cooking — Known for his kugel (a sweet noodle casserole), spaghetti, and participation in family Shabbat dinners and Seder preparations.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Ben is analytical, methodical, and somewhat emotionally detached in his communication style, traits the narrative attributes to undiagnosed autism spectrum characteristics. He speaks carefully and deliberately, mixing dry humor with genuine concern in a way that can appear reserved but conceals deep feeling. His approach to problems is systematic — he gravitates toward structural and institutional solutions rather than reactive ones, a tendency reflected in both his professional work and his parenting philosophy. He frames his city planning career as a form of systemic protection, contrasting it with the reactive nature of gun ownership or vigilantism.

Beneath the measured exterior, Ben cares profoundly about his family's safety and struggles with fear he rarely articulates directly. He has expressed insecurity about his own career compared to Sam's heroism and has argued with Pop-Pop Moe about whether his primary duty is to protect his daughter or to support her choices. He understands Sam's self-destructive tendencies from his own past experiences as an activist and metalhead — a background that gives him unique insight into her compulsive drive to fix things, even at personal cost. His conversations with Sam frequently center on the difference between fixing problems and dealing with people, and on the importance of living long enough to see one's work through.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Samantha "Sam" Small (Bloodhound) Daughter Knows about her superhero activities. Initially resistant, evolved to measured support with restrictions. Took Sam to the gun range, teaches her about systemic versus reactive problem-solving. Shot Rush Order to protect her. Rachel Small Wife Partners in navigating Sam's vigilante life. Ben tends toward analytical detachment while Rachel is more emotionally expressive. They present a united front despite differing approaches, sometimes functioning as "bad cop" and "good cop." Morris "Pop-Pop Moe" Small Father Moe taught Ben to shoot and instilled his philosophy about power and self-reliance. They have argued about Sam's heroism — Ben fears for her safety while Moe encourages her calling. Their relationship is loving but carries unresolved tension. Victor Blanc Father-in-law (estranged) Had a physical altercation with Victor that contributed to the estrangement. When Victor appeared at the Small home uninvited, Ben placed a gun and magazine on the kitchen table as a precaution and watched tensely from the kitchen doorway. Dean Carver (Rush Order) Adversary Shot Rush Order during the South Street confrontation. Rush Order subsequently placed Ben under Rogue Wave's "protection" and released a public video framing Ben's actions as exemplifying Rogue Wave's philosophy of individual empowerment. Niles Nolan (Shrike) Adversary Confronted Shrike with his firearm during the home invasion but was neutralized when Shrike threatened to activate hidden spikes throughout the house. Jordan Westwood (Safeguard) Daughter's teammate Jordan defended Sam's heroism at the hospital, stating she was "more a hero than anyone else I've met." Ben has come to accept the Auditors as part of Sam's life. Dr. Eleanor Kaplan Family therapist Facilitates family therapy sessions addressing Sam's retirement, Ben's gun ownership, and the family's overlapping anxieties about safety and control.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Ben's social media nickname "Gun Dad" (and the more irreverent "Gun DILF") trended after bystander video of the South Street confrontation went viral. News media also used "Gun Dad" in subsequent coverage.
  • Gun sales in Philadelphia spiked 300% following the "Gun Dad" incident, with Rachel and her mother Camilla debating the implications of Ben's actions becoming a symbol for armed civilian resistance.
  • Rush Order, the Rogue Wave speedster Ben shot, developed a strange respect for Ben rather than resentment, and publicly declared him under Rogue Wave's protection.
  • Ben's gun, a Smith & Wesson M&P Shield, is stored in a biometric safe with ammunition kept separately — a detail explored extensively during family therapy and the gun range chapter.
  • His famous kugel (sweet noodle casserole) is mentioned as a comfort food he prepares before difficult family conversations.
  • Victor Blanc, Rachel's estranged father, struggled to remember Ben's name when contacted by a mysterious texter, highlighting how disconnected Victor had become from the family.
  • Ben mentioned the Divine Lorraine renovation during Sam's hospital birthday celebration, reflecting his professional interest in Philadelphia landmarks and urban development.
  • Pop-Pop Moe's philosophy that Ben passes to Sam — "Sometimes there won't be a superhero around, Benjy. Sometimes there's just you" — serves as a thematic throughline for Ben's character and his decision to intervene on South Street.
  • Ben attended Drexel University, where he met Rachel. Shrike targeted the university during his campaign of intimidation against Sam, among other schools associated with the Small family.

docs.title: Bianca Agnelli
docs.text: Ex-firefighter turned gadgeteer for the Delaware Valley Defenders, whose Tinker-type power lets her build anything tangentially related to firefighting.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Bianca Agnelli Aliases Fury Forge Date of Birth Unknown Age 30s Gender Female Ethnicity Italian-American Place of Birth Unknown Residence Philadelphia, PA Affiliation Delaware Valley Defenders (DVD) Former Affiliations Philadelphia Fire Department (former firefighter) Occupation Registered Superhuman Entity (DVD member), Gadgeteer / Tech Specialist Status Active First Appearance Chapter 5 (mentioned via locker) Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Bianca Agnelli is a former firefighter who became a member of the Delaware Valley Defenders, Philadelphia's only registered superhuman team. As a registered superhuman entity, her identity is public record and she operates as a federal employee. Prior to her superhero career, she served in the Philadelphia Fire Department, an experience that directly shaped the nature of her Tinker-type power and her aggressive, intervention-first approach to heroism.

Within the DVD, Bianca fills the role of the team's primary gadgeteer and tech specialist. She designs, builds, and maintains specialized equipment for herself and her teammates, leveraging her power's firefighting theme to produce an impressive range of devices. Her creations include surveillance robots, emergency pagers with perpetual batteries, fire suppression gear, advanced smoke filtration masks, and a custom hearing aid for the private investigator Devonte Harris. Despite this prolific output, Bianca has not revealed the full extent of her power level to Sam Small or other younger heroes, keeping her most capable inventions reserved for the DVD's internal use.

Bianca was already a member of the DVD during Sam Small's recruitment into the Young Defenders in August 2023, though she was initially present only as a name on a locker at the team's Center City headquarters. She became a more active presence in Sam's life over the course of the story, eventually serving as a personal confidant when Sam sought comfort at Bianca's home following her breakup with Jamila Fayad. Their bond, in part attributed by teammates to their shared queer identity, reflects Bianca's broader maternal protectiveness toward the younger heroes in the DVD's orbit.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Tinker-Type Creation (Firefighting-Themed) — Bianca possesses a Tinker-type power that allows her to design and construct virtually any device or piece of technology, provided it has at least a tangential connection to firefighting. This broad thematic umbrella encompasses an extremely wide range of inventions, as firefighting touches on thermal protection, structural engineering, hazardous materials handling, communications, search and rescue, breathing apparatus, chemical suppression, and emergency response logistics.
  • Surveillance Robotics — Has built robots capable of following superhero teams into the field to provide remote surveillance feeds to adult DVD members monitoring operations from headquarters. One such robot accompanied the Young Defenders during the Philly Phreaks confrontation on South Street.
  • Emergency Communications Equipment — Designed and distributed emergency pagers equipped with "forever batteries" to all Young Defenders members following the revelation of Chernobyl's potential alliance with the Kingdom of Keys.
  • Fire Suppression & Protection Gear — Created specialized firefighting equipment for field operatives, including lightweight fire blankets, foam capsules for fire suppression, and foldable smoke masks with advanced filtration systems. This equipment was provided to Sam during the Coyotes arson crisis.
  • Custom Hearing Aid (for Devonte Harris) — Designed a hearing aid for Devonte Harris (Ventriloquist) after he was deafened in one ear by a gunshot during the Operation Ivory investigation. The device is engineered to exploit Devonte's sound-stealing power by allowing him to steal sounds from the hearing aid's playback rather than from the environment directly, enabling him to use his abilities without silencing the original source.
  • Bomb Detection Systems — Built at least one bomb-detecting robot that was deployed during the Philly Phreaks battle, though it sustained damage during the conflict.
  • Fire Safety Inspection Equipment — Conducts fire safety assessments using her expertise and technology, as demonstrated when she inspected Tacony Charter Academy's fire safety systems following the Coyotes' arson campaign.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Bianca's Tinker-type power is constrained by its thematic requirement: all creations must relate, even tangentially, to firefighting. The precise boundaries of what qualifies as "tangentially related" are not fully documented.
  • She has not revealed the full extent of her capabilities to individuals outside the DVD's core membership, making a comprehensive assessment of her upper limits impossible from available information.
  • Her inventions appear to require conventional construction time and materials rather than instant manifestation, distinguishing her from pure Create-type metahumans.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Former professional firefighter with extensive knowledge of fire behavior, structural assessment, hazardous materials, and emergency response procedures.
  • Trained in the operational protocols of a registered superhuman team, including rules of engagement, chain of evidence procedures, and coordination with law enforcement.
  • Possesses practical engineering and fabrication skills that complement her Tinker-type power, enabling her to translate her intuitive designs into functional technology.
  • Experienced field combatant who has sustained injuries during operations, including during the Shrike confrontation at the Van Kirk construction site (treated and released from hospital).

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Bianca is defined by extremes of passion and protectiveness. She is aggressive, hotheaded, and reckless in a manner her teammates characterize as "cowboy cop tendencies," placing her at the impulsive end of the DVD's spectrum opposite Multiplex's rigid discipline. She almost certainly has ADHD, as evidenced by her attention drifting toward thoughts of new gear during briefings and her general difficulty with patience and restraint. Despite her hot-headedness, she has a functional grasp of due process and institutional rules; her frustration lies not in ignorance of why procedures exist but in the emotional difficulty of waiting when she knows action could help.

Her maternal instinct is one of her most prominent traits. She is fiercely protective of younger heroes, particularly Sam Small, whom she has taken under her wing in a way that blends mentorship with genuine familial warmth. When Sam appeared at Bianca's home after her breakup with Jamila, Bianca provided comfort without hesitation. Teammates have noted that Bianca's role as an openly queer adult in the DVD makes her a natural anchor for Sam, though Bianca's protectiveness extends to all the younger heroes regardless of identity. She advocates strongly for recruiting fresh perspectives and giving young metahumans opportunities, frequently clashing with more cautious colleagues like Multiplex over the pace of institutional change.

docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Sam Small (Bloodhound) Mentee / Protectee Bianca is fiercely protective of Sam and has served as an emotional confidant. She promised to help him with hearing implants after his injury during Operation Ivory. docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Bianca chose the codename "Fury Forge" because she thought it sounded cool, not because of any particular significance to her powers or background.
  • She is described through Sam's narration as extremely physically attractive, with a muscular, large build and tattoos covering her body from the shoulders down.
  • Bianca is one of the few openly queer adults in the DVD, which her colleague Elijah Brooks suggested is part of why Sam gravitates toward her as a confidant.
  • The hearing aid she designed for Devonte Harris represents one of the most creative applications of her Tinker-type power, as it technically qualifies as firefighting-adjacent through its connection to communication equipment used in emergency response.
  • Despite being described as having "cowboy cop tendencies," Bianca operates within a registered superhuman team that functions under federal employment rules and legal oversight, creating an inherent tension between her impulsive nature and her institutional obligations.
  • Her current status as of the beginning of Arc 16 is simply listed as "N/A, presumably working," suggesting she remains active but has not been the focus of recent narrative developments.
  • Bianca occupies a distinct ideological position within the DVD: she is more aggressive and action-oriented than Multiplex but shares Bulwark's frustration with institutional inertia, differing from Bulwark primarily in the specific reasons for her impatience.

docs.title: Blake Alexander Matthews
docs.text: Kingdom of Keys enforcer for the Philadelphia branch, a street-smart brawler who can transform into a biologically accurate Tyrannosaurus rex.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Blake Alexander Matthews Aliases Mr. Tyrannosaur (Kingdom codename), Rex Rampage (underground fighting alias), The Dino-Man of Trenton, Rexanon (paleontology forum handle), Mr. T, Mr. T-Rex Date of Birth April 3, 1989 Age 33–36 Gender Male Ethnicity Unknown Place of Birth Trenton, New Jersey Residence Philadelphia, PA (area) Affiliation Kingdom of Keys (Philadelphia branch) Former Affiliations Various criminal organizations (2016–2019), underground fighting circuits Occupation Kingdom enforcer, intimidator, and leg breaker Status Active First Appearance Chapter 25 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Blake Alexander Matthews was born in Trenton, New Jersey, the only child of Sarah Matthews, a local librarian, and Peter Matthews, a warehouse supervisor. He graduated from Trenton Central High School in 2007 and entered the workforce through a series of physically demanding jobs: gym assistant, freelance landscaping and construction, and security work at local bars and clubs. He obtained certifications in basic first aid, CPR, and attended various self-defense workshops, but did not pursue higher education beyond trade school.

Blake's metahuman ability to transform into a Tyrannosaurus rex manifested at some point before his entry into the criminal world. His early attempts to integrate his powers into legitimate work met with limited success. Stints as a personal trainer, private security contractor, and construction consultant all ended due to difficulties controlling his transformation and adhering to conventional workplace expectations. Between 2016 and 2022, he worked as an enforcer for various criminal organizations under the alias Rex Rampage, gaining experience in underworld dealings through straightforward, forceful methods.

Blake's recruitment into the Kingdom of Keys came through the underground fighting circuit. While fighting as Rex Rampage, he deliberately fought without using his dinosaur transformation, relying instead on raw technique and perseverance. After one such fight against a larger opponent called Sledgehammer, his sportsmanship and personal code caught attention. Sledgehammer offered him a security job and connected him to Mr. Bomb, leading to Blake's entry into the Kingdom organization around 2019. Within the Kingdom, he assumed the codename Mr. Tyrannosaur and rose to become the primary intimidator and in-house leg breaker for the Philadelphia branch.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Tyrannosaurus Rex Transformation — Blake can transform into a biologically accurate, anatomically complete Tyrannosaurus rex. The dinosaur form includes downy feathers, lip structures, near-vestigial arms, and a significant layer of body fat, reflecting current paleontological understanding. Notably, Blake's transformed form displayed these scientifically accurate features before they became widely known to the public, indicating the transformation produces a genuine specimen rather than one shaped by Blake's perception.
  • Transformation Process — The transformation takes approximately five seconds, during which Blake emits a burst of superheated steam hypothesized to be a byproduct of the rapid mass shift. Clothing and personal effects are temporarily stored in an extradimensional space during the transformation, reappearing when he reverts. Blake is not vulnerable during the transformation window.
  • Dinosaur-Form Physical Capabilities — In Tyrannosaurus form, Blake possesses all the natural abilities of the species: immense strength sufficient to demolish buildings, the ability to bite through metal and substantial structures, high top speed, and natural armor from the dinosaur's physiology. No special powers are required because physics does the rest of the work for a complete Tyrannosaurus rex.
  • Cognitive Continuity — Blake retains his full human intelligence while transformed, making his dinosaur form significantly more dangerous than a feral animal. He cannot communicate verbally in this form.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Injury Scaling — Injuries are proportionally scaled between his human and Tyrannosaurus forms. A minor injury in human form can become significant in Tyrannosaurus form, and vice versa.
  • Transformation Fatigue — Repeated transformations in quick succession are physically draining, though he can perform them frequently if needed.
  • No Verbal Communication — Blake cannot speak while in Tyrannosaurus form.
  • Collateral Damage — The sheer size and power of his dinosaur form makes precision difficult, leading to extensive property damage in most engagements.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Exceptionally gifted brawler capable of fighting most people to a standstill without using his powers, including superhumans. He is described as dangerously clever in combat and would be exceptionally dangerous with formal martial arts training.
  • Basic hand-to-hand combat training honed through participation in underground fighting circuits and various security and enforcement roles.
  • Actively researches Tyrannosaurus rex biology and keeps up with the latest paleontological literature to stay combat effective and learn new techniques for his dinosaur form, though he requires Dr. Trinh-Norwood to translate the more technical material.
  • Certified in basic first aid and CPR.
  • Completed trade school.
  • Experienced in demolition and heavy machinery operation from his construction background.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Blake is thuggish and not book smart, but dangerously clever in a fight and tactically intelligent in ways that people consistently underestimate. He reacts poorly to being demeaned, minimized, or disrespected, displaying bursts of anger or frustration in such situations. He views his criminal work as simply a different market from most jobs, approaching it with a blue-collar pragmatism. He enjoys women, booze, and cigarettes in a classic mobster fashion and gets along particularly well with his colleague Mr. Mudslide. He previously struggled with self-image, likely related to the drastic nature of his powers and the challenges they imposed on his ability to live a conventional life.

Blake is not particularly fond of dinosaurs in a general sense, a notable irony given his powers. People in his world do not choose their abilities. However, he studies Tyrannosaurus rex biology extensively out of practical necessity, using the latest scientific literature to improve his combat effectiveness. His online presence includes anonymous participation in paleontology forums, where he was easily identified as "Rexanon" due to poor spelling and a singleminded focus on speculative questions about Tyrannosaurus rex biology. He possesses a personal code of conduct, as demonstrated by his refusal to finish a downed opponent in the underground fighting circuit, and he shows the capacity for private doubt about the Kingdom's more dangerous operations.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 2: Keys Supporting First appears at the Crescent nightclub VIP section alongside Dr. Xenograft and Mrs. Heartstopper, where Sam and Jordan identify him as a Kingdom figure. Later attacks Sam's family home in Mayfair alongside Mrs. Z, transforming into a Tyrannosaurus rex and systematically destroying the house. Fought by Bulwark, who injures him and forces his retreat. Book 4: Exorcism Mentioned (Interlude) Appears alongside Mr. Polygraph in Interlude AMK.1 to intimidate Aaron McKinley over lost Kingdom money. Polygraph and Tyrannosaur assign Aaron to kill Bloodhound as punishment and redemption. Book 5: Mayfly Interlude (BM.1) POV interlude set at Kingdom headquarters in South Philadelphia, disguised as an accounting firm with a professional reception area, large fish tank, and a break room featuring luxurious amenities including a chandelier. Blake observes the Kingdom hierarchy and social dynamics, noting how news about superheroes on the break room television triggers resentment among members. Participates in a leadership discussion about the emerging Fly drug crisis when Mr. Polygraph arrives visibly injured from an encounter with Fly-powered "gutter punks." Blake suggests they either eliminate or recruit the Fly distributors. The interlude ends with Mr. Polygraph inviting Blake to unwind at a strip club, departing together in a Cadillac. Book 8: Big Supporting Serves as the Kingdom's primary distraction during the Philadelphia Zoo heist (Operation Ivory), appearing in dinosaur form to destroy the rhino enclosure and draw hero attention while the real theft of poison dart frogs occurs elsewhere. Fights Captain Plasma, who hits him at supersonic speed. Escapes with some followers despite the heroes' partial victory. Book 10: Plume Interlude (BM.2) POV interlude following the Kingdom's ambush of a prison transport convoy on the Pennsylvania Turnpike. Fights Captain Plasma on the highway, escapes via steam transformation after being hit by an anti-materiel round. The team retreats in a disguised plumbing van branded "Ace Flow Solutions" to a Kingdom-owned steakhouse in Lancaster, a money laundering front. During the van ride, the team mocks Mudslide's paper bag mask and its working-class symbolism, while Mrs. Jellyjam (revealed as the "Pink Suit" operative from the prison intervention) announces the Lancaster stop per Upper Management orders. At the steakhouse, team dynamics emerge through banter: Jellyjam reveals her name comes from the Goosebumps books, Yellowjacket describes Upper Management as "Quiet. Intense. Lots of hand sanitizer," and Mr. Nothing remains notably quiet throughout. Mrs. Doppelganger is revealed to have been the seemingly rogue SWAT agent during the prison transport operation. Blake reveals a pragmatic but wounded perspective. Book 13: Burn After Reading Interlude (BM.3) POV interlude at a Kingdom planning meeting at Bella Notte restaurant in Staten Island. Mr. Antithesis joins via video call -- highly unusual, as he has never before shown his face so casually -- and presents the Daedalus prison break operation contracted by Red Calf's Porcelain. Payment is set at $2 million per surviving operator, scheduled for September 10th during state senate hearings. Blake is designated as "contingency response" (drop a T-rex on it). He questions the timing, noting the distance between Harrisburg and Daedalus makes the distraction implausible. Mrs. Xenograft identifies a missing corridor in the blueprints, and when questioned about potential collateral escapes, Mr. Antithesis reveals Porcelain is "not concerned about collateral escapes." Blake speaks privately with Mrs. Quiet afterward; both agree the operation "smells wrong," with Quiet questioning why Red Calf would involve the Kingdom rather than handling the extraction themselves. Includes a flashback to Blake's underground fighting career as Rex Rampage against Sledgehammer, showing his personal code (refusing to finish a downed opponent) and his recruitment path into the Kingdom through Mr. Bomb.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Blake's Professional Asset Dossier was prepared by Mr. E and Mr. C of the Kingdom of Keys as a recruitment evaluation, recommending him for the "Mr./Mrs. T" position, with the suggestion of "Mr. Tyrannosaurus" as a codename.
  • The dossier notes that his dinosaur form displayed scientifically accurate features such as downy feathers and lip structures before these became widely accepted in paleontology, suggesting his transformation produces a genuine biological specimen.
  • His online alias "Rexanon" was easily identified on paleontology forums due to his poor spelling and singular fixation on Tyrannosaurus rex speculative biology.
  • The destruction of Sam Small's home in Mayfair is one of the most consequential Kingdom actions in the story, forcing Sam to relocate to Lily Chen's family rowhome in Bridesburg and serving as a repeated reference point for the Kingdom's threat level.
  • His criminal record includes arrests for disorderly conduct (2010), property damage (2012), illegal underground fighting (2014), assault and battery (2017), trespassing and vandalism (2019), and a public disturbance in Tyrannosaurus form (2021).
  • The recruitment dossier was embedded with an explosive tracker by Mr. B, set to detonate if moved to unauthorized locations or by unauthorized individuals.
  • In BM.1, Blake reflects on how ordinary people end up as part of a criminal enterprise, observing the contrast between the Kingdom HQ's luxurious break room and the reality of its operations.
  • Blake's social rapport with Mr. Polygraph is demonstrated in both BM.1 (departing for a strip club together in a Cadillac) and his broader partnership with Mudslide, marking him as one of the more socially connected operatives in the Philadelphia branch.
  • During BM.2, the team orders steaks at the Lancaster safehouse, with Blake and each operative revealing personality through their preferences.
  • Blake's questioning of the Daedalus operation's logic in BM.3 -- specifically noting that the distance between the senate hearings in Harrisburg and the prison in northern New York makes the supposed distraction implausible -- demonstrates his tactical intelligence despite his lack of formal education.

docs.title: Camilla de Leon
docs.text: Sam Small's estranged maternal grandmother whose unannounced arrival during Sam's hospital recovery reveals the family's Sephardic Jewish and Hispanic heritage, initiating a slow and contentious reintegration into the Small family.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Camilla de Leon Aliases N/A Date of Birth Unknown Age Seventies Gender Female Ethnicity Sephardic Jewish, Hispanic (heritage tracing to Brazil and Spain via the Alhambra Decree) Place of Birth Unknown Residence Unknown (drives a Lexus; location unspecified) Affiliation Small / de Leon family Former Affiliations N/A Occupation Retired (presumed) Status Active First Appearance Chapter 65 Last Appearance Chapter 186 (in person)

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Camilla de Leon is Sam Small's maternal grandmother and the mother of Rachel Small (nee de Leon). She is Sephardic Jewish with Hispanic heritage tracing back to Brazil and Spain via the Alhambra Decree of 1492 -- the expulsion of Jews from Spain. This dual heritage means Sam carries both Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry (paternal, through the Small family) and Sephardic/Hispanic ancestry (maternal, through Camilla), a fact Sam did not learn until meeting Camilla for the first time during her hospital recovery.

Camilla's relationship with her daughter Rachel is described as "extremely tense" with "deep unspecified history." Camilla had a "rotating carousel" of boyfriends in her youth, and Rachel is the product of one of those relationships -- specifically with Victor Blanc, a long-haul trucker with antisocial personality disorder traits who was physically abusive before abandoning the family when Rachel was young. Both Rachel and Camilla agree that Sam should never meet Victor. Rachel's maiden name is "de Leon," though Sam's profile references the "Blanc family" in connection with her Hispanic heritage.

Camilla has a current partner named Jerry. She drives a Lexus and is described in the character reference guide as "snickety and snippy" -- and more bluntly, as difficult to get along with. Despite this, she has demonstrated unexpected depth: she supported Rachel's decision to testify against Maya Richardson's anti-vigilante legislation and offered financial support if Rachel faced professional consequences.

The character reference guide also notes that Camilla described her home as one of "passion, learning, and conflict," and that Rachel was a "firecracker" in her youth -- suggesting that the mother-daughter tension has deep roots in shared temperament as much as specific grievances.

docs.title: Powers & Abilities
docs.text: Camilla de Leon has no metahuman abilities.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Camilla is sharp-tongued, direct, and unafraid of confrontation. Her arrival at Sam's hospital room was unannounced and forced past Rachel's resistance, establishing her as someone who acts on her own terms regardless of others' boundaries. She can be abrasive and difficult -- the character reference guide's assessment is uncharitable but clear about her tendency toward conflict.

However, Camilla also demonstrates vulnerability and genuine desire for family connection. By Sam's fifteenth birthday, she sits near the hospital room door, "present but peripheral" -- maintaining distance but showing she wants to be part of Sam's life despite years of absence. Her surprising support for Rachel's political testimony and offer of financial backup reveal a capacity for solidarity that complicates the purely antagonistic reading of her character.

Pop-Pop Moe tactfully removes Camilla from the kitchen so Rachel can speak privately with Ben. Camilla surprisingly supports Rachel's decision to testify against Richardson's legislation and offers financial support if Rachel faces professional consequences. Later, Rachel and Camilla debate the implications of the 300% spike in gun sales following the "Gun Dad" incident involving Ben. Book 13: Burn After Reading Mentioned Referenced indirectly through the revelation that Rachel has a brother named David de Leon, disclosed by Victor Blanc (Ch. 200). This expands the de Leon family tree beyond what Camilla had previously revealed. Book 14: Shelter in Place Mentioned Rachel mentions that her grandmother (Camilla's mother / Sam's maternal great-grandmother) died from lung cancer (Ch. 206), referenced in the context of concerns about Sam's regeneration and cancer risks.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Camilla's Sephardic Jewish heritage traces back to the Alhambra Decree of 1492, the expulsion of Jews from Spain, connecting the de Leon family to Brazil and Spain. This merges Sam's Ashkenazi Jewish paternal heritage with Sephardic/Hispanic maternal heritage.
  • The character reference guide describes Camilla bluntly as "kind of a cunt" who had a "rotating carousel" of boyfriends in her youth, from which Rachel was born. This is the guide's characterization, not a narrative judgment.
  • She is referred to as "Camilla Blanc" exactly once in the entire knowledge base (in Sam's relationship table), while "Camilla de Leon" is used everywhere else. "Blanc" is Victor's surname; "de Leon" appears to be Camilla's own family name.
  • Rachel's maiden name is documented inconsistently: "Rachel Small (nee de Leon)" in Rachel's own profile versus references to the "Blanc family" in Sam's profile. "De Leon" appears to be the correct maternal family name.
  • The grandmother who "died from lung cancer" mentioned in Book 14 (Ch. 206) appears to be Camilla's mother (Sam's great-grandmother), not Camilla herself, since Camilla is alive through the end of the documented arcs.
  • The slow defrosting of Camilla's relationship with the Small family is tracked as a progressing thread across the intermission and later arcs.
  • David de Leon, Rachel's brother and Sam's uncle, is revealed by Victor in Book 13 but remains completely unexplored as a character.

docs.title: Chezki Espinosa
docs.text: The "world's strongest superhuman," de facto leader of the private military contractor Red Calf, and a former Mossad operative whose activation event during a friendly fire incident in Rafah transformed him into a near-indestructible force of nature.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Chezki Espinosa Aliases Porcelain Date of Birth Unknown (approximately 1985–1986) Age 40 Gender Male Ethnicity Israeli Place of Birth Haifa, Israel (implied) Residence Zurich, Switzerland (Red Calf headquarters, suspected) Affiliation Red Calf (de facto leader) Former Affiliations Mossad, Israel Defense Forces Occupation PMC leader, high-lethality field operative specializing in assassination and sabotage Status Active First Appearance Chapter 48 (mentioned as "Porcelain?" in Liberty Belle's notebook); Interlude MR.4 (first on-screen appearance) Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Chezki Espinosa began his military service at age eighteen, entering the Israel Defense Forces before advancing into Mossad as a specialized operative. After approximately four years of service carrying out operations in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Espinosa experienced a superhuman activation event during a mission in Rafah, Gaza. His unit was directed to neutralize a target named Mohammed al-Rashidi in a residential building. When intelligence redirected the team to a secondary structure, the building was shelled by Israeli artillery while Espinosa was still inside. The strike, which killed his teammate Yosef and was later recognized as deliberate friendly fire, buried Espinosa under tons of rubble. He emerged alive, having manifested extreme physical durability and strength that rendered him virtually indestructible.

The Israeli government quickly recognized the value of Espinosa's abilities and turned him into a national asset. He was deployed as a one-man demolition force across Iran, Lebanon, Syria, and other conflict zones, carrying out missions that those in comfortable offices marked on maps. In the intervening years, Espinosa wore weighted clothing to remain grounded — fifteen kilograms sewn into his suit jacket lining and another ten in a vest beneath his shirt, weights that had to be recalibrated every few months as his body continued to densify. By 2011, his body had grown so dense and powerful that custom porcelain armor weighing one hundred and sixty kilograms was designed to allow him to interact with the world without destroying it. He was housed in a special dormitory and deployed continuously across Iran, Lebanon, and Syria, reducing targets to coordinates and people to designations. His mother in Haifa remained the only person who still called him, asking when he was coming home, when he was getting married, when he would give her grandchildren — normal questions he could not answer. Over the years, Espinosa grew disillusioned with the men who directed him, viewing their perpetual warfare as self-serving rather than motivated by genuine security concerns. A deputy minister once told him, "You don't need to understand. You just need to perform."

Espinosa's break with Israel came approximately eleven years before the main story timeline (circa 2014–2015) at a classified security briefing in the Knesset. Invited to be displayed before politicians and generals — twelve men around a table in a chamber off the main floor — he sat through two hours of briefings on regional threats while watching the comfortable officials laugh, drink warm coffee, and make jokes during a meeting about casualty projections. He then confronted the assembled officials, accusing them of perpetuating unnecessary violence for their own benefit and of shelling the Rafah building with him inside. He physically seized a general by the skull — a man with soft hands and a vacation tan who soiled himself in terror — delivered a scathing denunciation of the establishment, declaring that "the cruelty is the purpose," killed the man, announced his resignation, and walked out. The Israeli government covered up the incident, blaming the death on Hamas. Espinosa fled to a safe house in Cyprus, where he attempted to clean blood from under his fingernails with a pocketknife and discovered he could still bleed when the blade punctured his skin — a detail that surprised him, as he had nearly forgotten the sensation. Cross contacted him via encrypted message ("Heard about your retirement. Coffee?") and invited him to Zurich, where the two and other former government operatives they had connected with during the Daedalus project founded Red Calf Security Solutions in 2015.

As de facto leader of Red Calf, Espinosa has shaped the organization according to his nihilistic philosophy: a world of perpetual escalating warfare where humanity either evolves from the ashes or proves his belief that the cruelty is the purpose. Under his direction, Red Calf has become one of the most feared and best-compensated employers of metahumans in the world, implicated in numerous war crimes but too useful to major governments to face real scrutiny.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text:
Field Value Classification G10 (extreme durability and strength) Category Gigant Power Ranking 10/10 Control Unknown Hostility Unknown Collateral Damage Unknown Threat Level Extreme

Espinosa is one of the few G10-rated superhumans on record. His PERKS assessment is referenced in intelligence briefings but the full breakdown beyond his classification and power ranking has not been disclosed.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Superhuman Strength — Muscle-based super-strength on a scale entirely beyond other known superhumans. Described as the "world's strongest superhuman," capable of giving fictional benchmarks like Superman or Homelander a competitive fight. His strength manifested during his activation event when he lifted a concrete slab weighing several hundred kilograms while buried under a collapsed building with a broken arm.
  • Near-Impenetrable Skin — His skin and body have become so dense and durable that conventional weapons, including small arms fire, are entirely ineffective against him. A Palestinian youth struck him with a chunk of concrete at full force and the concrete chipped off his skin without leaving a mark. He is described as impervious to most small arms and able to neutralize armored threats in close combat.
  • Accelerated Healing — Espinosa demonstrated rapid healing immediately after his activation event, when a broken arm that should have been shattered beyond repair showed only fading bruises within hours. During the Rafah debriefing, military doctors could find no evidence of the fracture. Later, in the Cyprus safehouse, a pocketknife puncture to his finger still produced blood, suggesting that while his durability had become extreme, he retained some capacity to be wounded by sharp implements at close range during that period.
  • Progressive Physical Enhancement — Espinosa's body continues to build itself without his input, growing denser and stronger over time. His muscle mass increases without exercise or nutrition, his bones become denser, and his overall weight steadily climbs. Without his weighted armor, he described feeling as though gravity had forgotten how to hold him. This ongoing enhancement has made it increasingly difficult for him to interact with the normal world without specialized equipment.
  • Primal Intimidation Aura — Espinosa's physical presence triggers an instinctive fear response in those around him, described as the "lizard brain recognizing a predator before the conscious mind catches up." Even the man seated beside him on his flight to New York shifted away without realizing he was doing it. This effect persists even among powerful political and military figures; the entire room of Knesset officials visibly contracted away from him when he took a step forward.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Environmental Destruction — Espinosa's sheer strength and density make normal interaction with the world extremely difficult. Without his weighted porcelain armor, he cracks concrete simply by walking and cannot touch objects without risking their destruction.
  • Porcelain Armor Dependency — He wears custom hyper-weighted porcelain armor weighing approximately one hundred and sixty kilograms to dampen his strength enough to interact with his environment in a quasi-normal fashion. Without it, basic tasks like holding a cup, shaking hands, or sitting in a chair require careful force calculation.
  • Progressive Isolation — His body's continuing densification means the armor must be periodically upgraded with additional weight, and the gap between his physical capabilities and the fragile world around him continues to widen.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Extensively trained in Mossad special operations, including unarmed combat, small arms proficiency, and demolitions.
  • Years of field experience conducting covert operations, assassinations, and sabotage missions across the Middle East, North Africa, and beyond.
  • Strategic and tactical leadership experience running Red Calf's global operations.
  • Proficient in operational planning and coordination of combined conventional and superhuman military operations.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Espinosa is confident, quiet, and professional. He does not mince words and carries himself with a calm, calculated demeanor that contrasts sharply with the enormous weight of his demands and the threat he represents. He is not conventionally supervillainous; those who interact with him describe the experience less as encountering a madman and more as dealing with an implacable force that simply cannot be refused. His presence triggers a primal recognition in others, a lizard-brain awareness of a predator that manifests even in powerful figures like Mr. Antithesis, who destroyed his own office in frustrated rage after meeting with Porcelain.

Espinosa monitors his own heart rate as a matter of habit — sixty-eight to seventy beats per minute during combat operations — the way other people check the weather. He drinks black coffee, invariably cold by the time he gets to it, a recurring ritual that persists from his IDF days through his Knesset confrontation and beyond. Beneath the professionalism lies an anarchistic nihilist whose worldview was forged in the rubble of Rafah and hardened by years of being used as a disposable weapon. He does not believe the violence itself was wrong but rather that it was unnecessary violence conducted by comfortable men who treated warfare as a way to justify their own power. His philosophy has crystallized into a vision of perpetual escalating conflict, where stability is never allowed to form and humanity must either evolve or be proven unworthy. He orchestrates chaos on a global scale with methodical precision, timing crises across multiple cities to maximize disruption.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Dov IDF teammate (survived) Espinosa's teammate during the Rafah operation. Dov had a pregnant wife, Miriam, expecting their first child, a girl they planned to name Shira. He survived the building collapse and was found sitting on an armored vehicle in shock afterward. One of Espinosa's last thoughts before the collapse was that Dov's daughter would have her father. Yosef IDF teammate (deceased) A young, barely twenty-year-old teammate who still flinched when shooting started. Killed by shrapnel to the throat during the Rafah operation while covering the perimeter. Espinosa visited his grave once between deployments and found grass growing on it; Yosef's parents thanked Espinosa for his service without knowing the full circumstances of their son's death. Director Harrison Daedalus project director American official who welcomed Espinosa to the Daedalus construction project as a consulting specialist. Described Espinosa as Israel's "contribution to the international effort." Maintained a professional demeanor around Espinosa despite awareness of his capabilities. Espinosa's Mother Mother Lives in Haifa. The only person who still called Espinosa during his years as Israel's weapon, persistently asking when he was coming home, getting married, and giving her grandchildren. Espinosa let her calls go to voicemail and told himself he would call back later. Jared Cross (Tarbaby) Co-founder / Colleague Met during Daedalus construction in 2006–2007 when Cross served as a stress tester for the containment cells, producing corrosive substances to probe the facility's defenses. The two recognized each other as former government tools over coffee in the empty commissary. Cross was formerly British Royal Engineers, then freelance. He invited Espinosa to Zurich after his break with Israel, leading to Red Calf's founding. Maya Richardson (Mrs. Zenith) Subordinate (Kingdom intermediary) Meets with Richardson to demand Kingdom assistance with the Daedalus prison break. Richardson cannot refuse his requests. Trent Fairfax (Mr. Antithesis) Subordinate (Kingdom leader) The Kingdom of Keys operates subordinate to Red Calf. Porcelain's demands cause Antithesis rare emotional distress and he threatens to expose Richardson's connections if refused. Morris "Pop-pop" Small Historical acquaintance Met Pop-pop during Daedalus construction in 2006–2007 as an Israeli consultant named "Espinosa." Espinosa studied Morris's file upon arrival and noted his family history — second-generation American, father arrived as a child refugee in the 1930s, the family that sent him vanished into the camps. Espinosa recognized in Morris the look of a diaspora Jew who grew up in the shadow of survival and approached him to praise his weatherproofing work, calling it important and noting that Morris "understood the assignment better than most." Morris deflected the compliment with a joke about comic books. Liberty Belle (Diane Williams) Subject of investigation Belle investigated Porcelain before her death, connecting him to Daedalus and writing "Porcelain?" in her notebook. Pop-pop confirmed the Espinosa-Porcelain link to Belle. Sam Small (Bloodhound) Adversary (indirect) Sam discovers the Porcelain-Espinosa-Daedalus connection through Belle's notes and library archives. Porcelain's operations directly impact Sam's world. Daisy Zhen (Deathgirl) Target of interest Red Calf orchestrated the Daedalus prison break specifically to extract Deathgirl, viewing her power-copying abilities as a valuable weapon. Observed her courthouse hearing after her escape. Samuel Royce (Gallows) Colleague Red Calf operative; former U.S. Marine sniper who "doesn't talk about why he left the Marines." Met during Daedalus construction period. Espinosa described the mutual recognition among the Daedalus consultants as "tools that have realized they're being used." Anika Voss (Lotus) Colleague Red Calf operative; former Slovak intelligence officer who "speaks seven languages and none of them contain the word truth." Met during Daedalus construction period. Lt. Gen. Dominic Hartley Colleague Red Calf COO; former British general who retired after an incident that never made the papers. Met during Daedalus construction period as one of the specialists who "consults" on containment projects. Kingdom of Keys Organizational subordinate The Kingdom operates under Red Calf's authority, carrying out contracted operations and receiving directives from Porcelain.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 4: Exorcism Mentioned The name "Porcelain?" appears underlined in red ink in Liberty Belle's notebook about Chernobyl, discovered by Sam during her investigation of Belle's materials (Chapter 48). This is the first reference to the character in the story. Book 10: Plume Interlude (MR.4) First on-screen appearance. Porcelain meets Maya Richardson in a sterile office space after her recruitment meeting for Argus Corps. He commends her recent successes, requests her assistance in extracting a dangerous individual (implied to be Deathgirl) from Daedalus Correctional Facility, and demonstrates calm authority that leaves Richardson unable to refuse. He also inquires about purchasing Hypeman for Red Calf. Book 13: Burn After Reading Supporting Major presence across multiple interludes and referenced events. In Interlude MR.8, Porcelain meets with Mr. Antithesis at the Kingdom's Manhattan office, demanding the Kingdom execute the Daedalus prison break on September 10th. His meeting leaves Antithesis so distressed he destroys his own office. He threatens to expose Richardson's Kingdom connections if they refuse, and specifically schedules the operation during state senate hearings to exploit the protests as a distraction. In Interlude MS.1, Pop-pop Small's flashback reveals "Espinosa" was an Israeli consultant at the Daedalus construction site in 2006–2007, and Pop-pop confirms to Sam that Belle showed him a photo connecting Espinosa to Porcelain. In Interlude BM.3, Mr. Antithesis reveals to Kingdom operatives that they have been contracted by Red Calf and Porcelain specifically to extract Deathgirl, offering $2 million per surviving operator. In Chapter 196, Sam discovers documents in the Morrison Collection linking "Chezki Espinosa" (Israeli military trainer from 2006) to Porcelain, along with information about Red Calf Security Solutions founded in 2015. In Interlude EW.1, the Daedalus prison break is executed as a forced collaboration between the Kingdom and Red Calf, with Red Calf operatives Vector and Tarbaby participating alongside Kingdom members. In Interlude DZ.2, a mysterious observer at Daisy Zhen's courthouse hearing is identified as Porcelain/Chezki Espinosa, indicating Red Calf's continued interest in Deathgirl after her escape. The arc summary confirms that Porcelain orchestrated simultaneous crises across multiple cities as part of his manufactured chaos strategy. Book 14: Shelter in Place Mentioned Red Calf situation referenced as occurring in Germany, diverting federal resources and leaving Philadelphia vulnerable to Kingdom operations during a blizzard engineered by Maya Richardson. Intermission 15.5: This Side Up Interlude (CE.1) Porcelain's origin story told in first person. Chronicles his Mossad career, beginning with the Rafah operation in which his unit was sent to capture Mohammed al-Rashidi in a residential building. After intelligence redirected the team to a secondary building, Israeli artillery shelled the structure with Espinosa inside — a deliberate tactical decision. Teammate Yosef was killed by shrapnel; teammate Dov survived. Espinosa's activation event occurred as he pushed a concrete slab weighing several hundred kilograms off himself with a broken arm. He emerged to find the building completely leveled and was struck by a Palestinian youth with a concrete chunk that shattered against his unmarked skin. The debriefing revealed his injuries had already healed, and no one apologized for shelling the building. Subsequent scenes cover his deployment across Iran, Lebanon, and Syria; his flight to New York wearing weighted clothing (25 kg total); his arrival at the Daedalus construction project where he met Director Harrison, stress tester Jared Cross, and weatherproofing contractor Morris "Moe" Small; nighttime scenes of removing weights and feeling untethered from gravity; the arrival of his 160 kg porcelain armor in 2011; his dramatic resignation at a Knesset security briefing where he seized a general, denounced the establishment, killed the general, and walked out; his retreat to a Cyprus safehouse where Cross contacted him; and his departure for Zurich. The interlude also references other figures Espinosa met during the Daedalus period — Royce (American sniper), Voss (Slovak intelligence), and Hartley (British general) — who later became Red Calf colleagues.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• The codename "Porcelain" derives from the white ceramic composite armor he wears to dampen his strength, which Israeli propagandists used to create a symbolic image of a gleaming guardian angel.
  • Red Calf's official public mission statement is "To provide effective, ethical, and innovative military solutions to governments and organizations committed to the pursuit of global security," a stark contrast to its actual operations.
  • The core leadership of Red Calf all met during the 2006–2007 Daedalus construction project, where they served as consultants and contractors from various national agencies.
  • Pop-pop Small recognized Espinosa as a fellow Jew during their brief interaction at Daedalus and noted the difference between Israeli and diaspora Jewish identity.
  • The Interlude CE.1 origin story opens and closes with lyrics from Butthole Surfers' "Pepper," framing the narrative of violence and disillusionment.
  • During the Rafah operation, Espinosa monitored his heart rate at sixty-eight to seventy beats per minute while breaching a building — a discipline he described as telling him "what kind of day you're going to have."
  • Espinosa's flight to New York for the Daedalus consulting assignment took eleven hours, during which he pretended to sleep while the passenger next to him unconsciously shifted away.
  • At the Daedalus commissary, Cross made coffee with the efficiency of "someone who has done it a thousand times in a thousand temporary facilities" and handed Espinosa a cup black without asking how he took it.
  • When removing his 25 kg of weights at night in his Daedalus quarters, Espinosa felt as though he might float away, as if gravity had forgotten how to hold him.
  • Espinosa's Knesset confrontation included him drinking cold Starbucks coffee from a plastic cup during the two-hour briefing — a detail that parallels his habitual cold coffee consumption throughout the interlude.
  • The general Espinosa killed at the Knesset soiled himself in terror. Espinosa described the moment with dark humor, noting "What — ha ha — like they could arrest me?"
  • In the Cyprus safehouse, Espinosa attempted to clean blood from under his fingernails with a pocketknife, but the blade tip punctured when he pushed too hard and the metal buckled, producing a shallow cut that bled — a sensation he had nearly forgotten he was capable of experiencing.
  • Red Calf is officially listed as "not a designated terrorist organization" despite its extensive war crimes implications, largely because it remains too useful to the United States for real scrutiny.
  • Approximately 30–40% of Red Calf's active operatives are powered individuals, with custom equipment tailored to their abilities.
  • The intelligence community considers Espinosa a priority surveillance target and regards countermeasure development against his enhanced physiology as a critical need.

docs.title: Claymore
docs.text: Explosive-bodied metahuman and breaching specialist for the Boston Red Shocks, a leftist direct-action cell operating in Boston, Massachusetts.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Unknown (first name possibly "Clay") Aliases Claymore, Clay Date of Birth Unknown Age Unknown (young woman, likely late teens to early twenties) Gender Female Ethnicity Unknown Place of Birth Unknown Residence Boston, Massachusetts Affiliation Boston Red Shocks Former Affiliations N/A Occupation Breaching specialist (Red Shocks); formerly aspiring journalist Status Active First Appearance CM.1 (Intermission 15.5: This Side Up) Last Appearance CM.1

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Claymore was a young woman with a background in journalism who underwent a traumatic activation event at the Boston Commons during the September 9, 2025 protests. The incident -- widely reported as a "suspected terrorist attack" with "multiple explosions" -- was later identified as an activation event rather than a conventional bombing. Claymore's powers manifested involuntarily under stress, producing a flash and pressure wave that injured approximately one hundred people who had been protesting alongside her. She also vaporized her own hair during the uncontrolled discharge. The experience left her deeply guilt-ridden and struggling to manage both her new abilities and the constant mental calculations of blast radii that accompanied them.

In the months following her activation, Claymore trained alone in an abandoned shipping facility in South Boston, attempting to learn control through trial and error. The Boston Red Shocks discovered her during one of these sessions after detecting repeated explosions in their operational area. The Colonel, the team's leader, approached Claymore and offered her a place to train with people who understood what she was going through. After initial wariness, Claymore accepted and began training under the group's guidance, learning to scale her explosive output with precision rather than relying on raw destructive force.

By approximately January 2026, roughly four months after her activation event, Claymore had become a functional member of the Red Shocks and participated in her first operational mission: a break-in at Alcott Properties in the Seaport district of Boston to copy documents proving collusion between the developer and city officials in expediting evictions in East Boston.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Explosive Body Part Detonation -- Claymore could detach parts of her body -- fingernails, hair, and larger segments such as fingers or thumbs -- and cause them to detonate on impact. The detonation converted biological tissue into concussive force (pressure waves rather than thermal energy). Each body part carried a specific energy yield: a single fingernail produced approximately 150 joules, sufficient to crack a deadbolt or shatter a window. A full finger produced approximately 800 joules. Ghostwriter estimated her overall explosive density at roughly two-thirds that of dynamite, with significantly less waste heat.
  • Impact Detonation -- Detached body parts could be set to detonate on impact. Claymore threw or placed fingernails and hair at targets and then triggered detonation through physical impact, such as striking them with a hammer. She also used hair as improvised detonation cord, tying it around fingernails placed inside lock mechanisms.
  • Scalable Yield -- Claymore demonstrated precise control over the amount of force generated by varying the quantity and type of tissue expended. She calibrated her output to specific tasks: two fingernails for a keycard lock (approximately 200 joules), three to four fingernails for a heavy steel service door (300-350 joules), and smaller amounts of hair for interior locks.
  • Rapid Regeneration -- All detached or detonated body parts regenerated. Fingernails regrew in approximately 30 to 40 minutes. A severed thumb regenerated fully in one to two hours, with a thick callus forming instantly over the wound to seal it. Hair also regrew rapidly, with the scalp itching as new growth replaced what had been pulled out. The regeneration process was metabolically expensive, requiring significant caloric intake to offset tissue loss.
  • Tissue Detachment -- Claymore could voluntarily detach body parts without pain, experiencing only a soft "click" of disconnection. Callus tissue formed immediately over exposed surfaces. She could detach fingernails, pull out hair in bunches (complete with root bulbs), and separate larger segments such as fingers, though larger detachments were more costly.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Detached body parts could not be reattached; once removed, they were permanently separated from the body and could only be replaced through regeneration.
  • Regeneration imposed a significant caloric debt. Claymore had to front-load food intake before operations and experienced intense hunger afterward. She consumed dense protein bars and large quantities of food to offset the metabolic cost.
  • Fingernails were aerodynamically poor projectiles, described as "fluttery," making accurate throws more difficult than with denser objects.
  • Claymore could not shape her blasts with full precision early in her training; her activation event produced an uncontrolled omnidirectional pressure wave.
  • The constant mental calculation of blast radii and destructive potential was psychologically taxing and could not be turned off.
  • Larger expenditures (full fingers, thumbs) produced proportionally more force but required longer regeneration times and greater caloric cost.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Trained in breaching techniques under the Red Shocks, learning to calibrate explosive yield to specific structural targets (padlocks, deadbolts, reinforced doors, keycard locks).
  • Possessed a journalism background, with a self-described "journalism reflex" for cataloging environmental details automatically.
  • Read Russian literature recreationally prior to her activation (specifically The Master and Margarita by Bulgakov).
  • Had a brother with some technical knowledge.
  • Trained to maintain tactical awareness, habitually positioning herself with back to walls, sightlines to exits, and awareness of blast radii.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Claymore was analytical, self-aware, and haunted by her activation event. She processed the world through constant observation and internal narration, a habit she attributed to her journalism background. She cataloged details compulsively -- room dimensions, structural materials, potential blast yields -- in a running mental assessment she could not silence. She described this as "a song I cannot stop humming." Despite her guilt over the Commons incident, she channeled her abilities toward purposeful action, finding comfort in the precision and control she developed under the Red Shocks' tutelage.

She used humor and sarcasm as deflection, cracking jokes to cover visible anxiety (such as shaking hands) and engaging in the team's banter despite being the newest member. She was acutely conscious of being the "new variable" in an established group dynamic and worked to find her place without forcing it. Claymore drew a firm moral line between herself and indiscriminate violence, taking the distinction between targeted property damage and harm to people seriously. Her internal monologue repeatedly returned to the fear of losing control and the imperative of choosing restraint, reflecting a deep-seated need to prove -- to herself above all -- that she was "a person who can make bombs" rather than a bomb.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes The Colonel Leader / Mentor Leader of the Boston Red Shocks who recruited Claymore from the abandoned shipping facility in Southie. Communicated in economical silences and sparse acknowledgments. Claymore learned more from the Colonel's silences than from hours of conversation with others. Offered approval sparingly but meaningfully. Ghostwriter Teammate Red Shocks member who wore archival gloves and used books as part of his power set. Provided intellectual context and emotional check-ins for Claymore. Estimated her explosive density and encouraged her to experiment with hair as a detonation medium. Called her "Claymore" during operations. Red Scare Teammate Red Shocks member with a lean, wiry build and liquid movement quality. Taught self-defense classes at a community center in Jamaica Plain. Provided practical mentorship during training, coaching Claymore on the psychological adjustment to living with constant threat awareness. Assured her the mental calculations would get "quieter" over time. Lavender Girl Teammate Red Shocks member with plant-growth abilities who served as technical support and provided emotional warmth. Grew vegetables for mutual aid networks and made protein bars for Claymore's caloric needs. Reminded Claymore that using her power was "spending, not sacrificing" and reinforced the message that Claymore had agency over her choices.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Intermission 15.5: This Side Up POV (Interlude CM.1) Narrated a first-person account of her recruitment by the Boston Red Shocks, her training to control her explosive body part detonation abilities, and her first operational mission -- a break-in at Alcott Properties in the Seaport district to copy documents proving developer collusion with city officials in expediting evictions in East Boston. The interlude also depicted her activation event at the Boston Commons (September 9, 2025) in flashback, where she involuntarily injured approximately one hundred fellow protesters.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Claymore's interlude code is "CM," with CM.1 being her sole narrated chapter.
  • The Boston Commons explosion that served as Claymore's activation event was reported in the main story as a "suspected terrorist attack" during the September 9, 2025 protests, and was referenced in connection with the Daedalus prison break and state senate hearings as part of a sequence of potentially coordinated events. Reports from the main narrative noted that "no conventional bomb was used" and that evidence pointed to an activation incident.
  • The name "Claymore" is a reference to the Claymore directional mine, consistent with her explosive abilities. The shortened form "Clay" was used by teammates in casual conversation, while "Claymore" was reserved for operational contexts.
  • Ghostwriter estimated her explosive density at approximately two-thirds that of dynamite, but with significantly reduced waste heat.
  • She wore a "slitted cloth" tied around her face as a mask during her solo training period before joining the Red Shocks.
  • Claymore's hair vaporized during her activation event and subsequently regrew, suggesting her regeneration was active from the moment of activation.
  • She mentioned owning a Hitachi personal massager in a deflective joke during training, using crude humor to manage her anxiety about her own destructive capabilities.
  • The Red Shocks operated out of the basement of a used bookstore in Allston, with the owner maintaining plausible deniability about their activities.
  • Lavender Girl's protein bars were described as tasting "like cardboard and desperation."
  • Claymore's phone screen was cracked from being dropped during training, three days before the Alcott Properties operation, at the same moment she successfully blew a fist-sized hole in a concrete wall with exactly the intended yield.
  • The Alcott Properties mission took place in January, placing it roughly four months after Claymore's September 2025 activation event.
  • Ghostwriter suggested Claymore experiment with using her hair as an explosive medium, which she successfully adopted, using pulled hair as detonation cord and individual strands to breach interior locks.
  • Claymore compared the sensation of voluntarily detaching a fingernail to "unclenching a fist" and, more colorfully, to a bowel movement.
