docs.title: Lena Trinh-Norwood, PhD
docs.text: Kingdom of Keys scientific specialist and self-described "mad zoologist" responsible for creating chimeric organisms and developing the drugs Hypeman and Vysera.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Lena Trinh-Norwood, PhD Aliases Mrs. Xenograft, Dr. Xenograft, Mrs. X, Dr. X Date of Birth Unknown Age Late 30s Gender Female Ethnicity Vietnamese-American (implied by surname) Place of Birth Unknown Residence Philadelphia, PA Affiliation Kingdom of Keys (Philadelphia Branch) Former Affiliations Academic research (unspecified institution) Occupation Criminal scientist, drug developer, Kingdom of Keys operative Status Active First Appearance Chapter 25 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Lena Trinh-Norwood holds a PhD and worked as a genetic engineering researcher prior to joining the Kingdom of Keys. Before her recruitment, she operated out of a laboratory where she conducted research alongside her companion Scylla, an already-existing chimera of her own creation. Despite her evident brilliance, the conventional academic world frustrated her — the combination of ethical review boards, bureaucratic grant processes, and the indignity of supplementing her income with barista work left her deeply dissatisfied. She possessed metahuman abilities that allowed her to combine living organisms in ways that defied conventional biology, but mainstream science offered no legitimate outlet for this talent.

In approximately December 2021, Mrs. Zenith (Maya Richardson) and Mr. Bomb visited Trinh-Norwood's laboratory on behalf of the Kingdom of Keys. They bypassed security using Mr. Bomb's explosive powers and expressed interest in her unique abilities and research. Before departing, they planted an explosive device disguised as a cigarette that was linked to Trinh-Norwood and would detonate if certain conditions were not met. Burdened with this coercive device, she traveled through snowy streets with Scylla to a meeting at a bar owned by the Kingdom. There, Zenith and Bomb outlined their proposal: unlimited resources and freedom to pursue her research without ethical constraints, in exchange for creating genetically modified creatures for the organization. Trinh-Norwood accepted the offer, adopting the moniker "Dr. Xenograft," and resolved to push the boundaries of her work unshackled by conventional morality. Though the recruitment involved an element of coercion, Trinh-Norwood has consistently framed her decision as a pragmatic one — a steady paycheck and unfettered scientific freedom simply beat hustling for grants.

Within the Philadelphia branch of the Kingdom, Trinh-Norwood rose to become the de facto head of the organization's drug operations, developing both Hypeman and Vysera. Her role expanded well beyond creature creation into pharmacology and strategic planning, making her one of the most operationally significant members of the branch.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Chimeric Fusion ("Xenografting") — Can combine two animals into a single stable, sterile hybrid organism. The process operates on what Trinh-Norwood herself describes as "mad scientist rules," allowing her to match selected anatomical components in a modular, "lego style" fashion. The resulting chimeras combine chosen physical traits from both source organisms into a functional whole. The granularity and precision of this process scales directly with her knowledge of each animal's anatomy — the more she understands about a species, the more finely she can control which traits are selected, combined, or omitted.
  • Consciousness Merging — When two living animals are combined, their consciousnesses merge into a new gestalt consciousness that is neither wholly one nor the other. If one of the source animals is dead at the time of fusion, the surviving animal's consciousness assumes sole ownership of the new body. Trinh-Norwood prefers to work with one dead and one living specimen, as she finds the philosophical implications of true gestalt consciousness deeply uncomfortable.
  • Chimera Stability — Her creations are biologically stable and viable long-term. Chimeras function as coherent organisms rather than deteriorating or rejecting their combined components. They are, however, sterile and cannot reproduce.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Trinh-Norwood's power requires physical access to both source animals.
  • The quality and precision of her fusions are directly limited by her anatomical knowledge — species she is less familiar with produce cruder results.
  • Her creations are sterile and cannot breed.
  • Chimeras left near Mr. Antithesis appear to be adversely affected, implying that his power negation abilities may destabilize or harm organisms created through metahuman powers. This is why Scylla was left outside during Trinh-Norwood's meeting with him.
  • Trinh-Norwood herself has no combat-oriented metahuman abilities; she is physically a baseline human.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Holds a PhD, with extensive academic training in zoology, biology, genetics, and pharmacokinetics.
  • Exceptional knowledge of animal anatomy across a wide range of species, which directly enhances the precision of her power.
  • Highly skilled in animal husbandry, care, and training. Animals respond positively to her even without the use of her metahuman abilities — she possesses a natural aptitude for understanding and managing animal behavior.
  • Developed sophisticated pharmacological compounds including Hypeman (Compound J-237) and Vysera (daxerimab), demonstrating advanced expertise in drug design, biochemistry, and pharmacokinetics.
  • Understands the inner workings of Rogue Wave's Jump drug at a molecular level, including its compound architecture, delivery system requirements, and failure modes.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Trinh-Norwood is haughty, precise, and unapologetically pedantic. She speaks with the careful word choice of someone who considers language a tool of accuracy rather than social bonding. She is extremely autistic, particularly in matters relating to animals, and this manifests as both her greatest professional strength and her most pronounced social liability. She insists — with considerable irritation — on being referred to as a mad zoologist, not a mad scientist, a distinction she considers meaningful and non-negotiable. She has been observed becoming visibly distracted by a dying ficus plant during a strategic leadership meeting, and she engages in sarcastic exchanges with colleagues that suggest she views most people as operating at a lower intellectual register than herself.

One of Trinh-Norwood's most notable traits is her frequent failure to recognize social cues related to intimidation and threat. She often refuses to be cowed by dangerous individuals not out of bravery but because she is genuinely too socially unaware to register that she should be frightened. This quality makes her interactions with figures like Mr. Antithesis and Mr. Tyrannosaur distinctly different from those of her colleagues, who typically display appropriate deference or fear. Despite her general social detachment, she demonstrates scientific curiosity that can override her dismissiveness — when confronted with the existence of the Fly drug, she initially scoffed at the possibility of power-granting pills but quickly shifted to genuine scientific interest.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Maya Richardson (Mrs. Zenith) Superior / Recruiter Zenith recruited Trinh-Norwood into the Kingdom alongside Mr. Bomb. Zenith serves as the acting boss of the Philadelphia branch, and the two interact regularly on operational matters. Accompanied Trinh-Norwood to the meeting with Mr. Antithesis following Operation Ivory. Blake Matthews (Mr. Tyrannosaur) Colleague / Romantic tension The two do not particularly like each other and engage in frequent sarcastic exchanges. However, there is acknowledged sexual tension between them. Tyrannosaur consults her on paleontological literature to improve his combat effectiveness with his dinosaur transformation, though he needs her to translate the more technical material. Trent Fairfax (Mr. Antithesis) Superior (Kingdom leadership) Trinh-Norwood reported directly to Mr. Antithesis following the failed Operation Ivory, presenting Hypeman to justify her continued value. He rewarded her with a raise and profit-sharing but warned that future failures would not be tolerated. His power negation abilities appear to adversely affect her chimeric creations. Mr. Nothing (Darnell) Colleague Captured during Operation Ivory alongside Mudslide. Later coordinated with Trinh-Norwood on rebuilding Hypeman production in Camden after his liberation. Mr. Polygraph Colleague Fellow Philadelphia branch operative. Present during the Fly crisis discussion at Kingdom headquarters. Assigned to coordinate with Trinh-Norwood on Hypeman production. Mrs. Heartbeat Colleague Operated alongside Trinh-Norwood during Kingdom operations. Escaped the zoo heist with some of the stolen poison dart frogs. Sam Small (Bloodhound) Adversary Encountered Sam during the Crescent nightclub infiltration, where she sicced Scylla on her. Later met Sam unexpectedly at the Philadelphia Zoo, engaging in a surprisingly civil conversation about animals before warning her to be careful. Her chimeric creatures attacked Sam's home. Scylla Companion animal An immortal greyhound-lobster chimera and Trinh-Norwood's constant companion. Armored and combat-capable, trained to a high degree. Present with her from before she joined the Kingdom. Darwin Pet A glow-in-the-dark axolotl. Not a combat pet. Rogue Wave / Daisy Zhen Indirect connection Trinh-Norwood reverse-engineered aspects of Rogue Wave's Jump drug to create Hypeman, and cultured cells from Daisy Zhen to produce an analogous Compound B.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 2: Keys Supporting First appears at the Crescent nightclub in Chapter 25 as "Mrs. X" alongside Mrs. Heartbeat and Mr. Tyrannosaur. Sam and Jordan encounter her in the VIP section during their undercover infiltration. Identified as having a giant bluish greyhound named Scylla. Commands Scylla to attack Sam and Jordan when their cover is blown. Scylla pins Sam with precision. The Kingdom operatives interrogate the two teenagers before Sam and Jordan execute a dramatic escape. In Chapter 26, Crossroads identifies "Mrs. X" as Dr. Xenograft, a known villain who has recently joined the Kingdom. In Chapter 27, her chimeric creatures — raccoon-spider hybrids and crow-basset hound hybrids wearing shock collars — invade the Small family home. In Chapter 28, Mr. Tyrannosaur and Mrs. Z escalate the attack on the house, with Xenograft's diverse chimera menagerie (including opossum-copperhead hybrids, a rottweiler-deer hybrid, and a turtle-crab lockpicker) participating in the assault that ultimately destroys Sam's home. Intermission 4.5: Amnion Supporting Featured in Blake Matthews's interlude set in late April 2024. Appears at Kingdom headquarters in South Philadelphia (disguised as an accounting firm) alongside Mrs. Zenith, Mr. Tyrannosaur, and Mr. Polygraph. Becomes distracted by a dying ficus plant during a leadership meeting. Engages in sarcastic exchanges with Tyrannosaur, with Zenith mediating. Scylla is present and displays unusual characteristics. When Mr. Polygraph reports the emergence of the Fly drug, Trinh-Norwood initially dismisses the possibility of power-granting pills but shows scientific curiosity. The group debates the strategic implications of Fly for Kingdom operations. Book 6: Sideshow (Interlude LTN.1) Main (Interlude) Origin interlude set in approximately December 2021. Depicts Trinh-Norwood working alone in her lab with Scylla, finding solace in the sterile environment and her research, before being approached by Mrs. Zenith and Mr. Bomb, who bypass her lab security using Mr. Bomb's explosive powers. They plant a coercive explosive device disguised as a cigarette that is linked to Trinh-Norwood and will detonate if certain conditions are not met. Burdened with this device, she travels through snowy streets with Scylla to a dimly lit bar owned by the Kingdom of Keys. During the meeting, she is offered unlimited resources and scientific freedom in exchange for creating genetically modified creatures for the organization. Accepts the offer and adopts the name "Dr. Xenograft," resolving to prove her extraordinary abilities unshackled by conventional morality. Book 8: Big Supporting Sam and Tasha encounter Trinh-Norwood unexpectedly at the Philadelphia Zoo in Chapter 126 while investigating the Kingdom's interest in the facility. Trinh-Norwood engages Sam in a surprisingly civil conversation about animals and her work, reveals she is wearing a wire, and warns Sam to be careful. She explains her motivations for working with the Kingdom (money, primarily) before being escorted away by two men. The encounter is later recounted to the full Auditors team. Operation Ivory — the Kingdom's zoo heist — involves using Mr. Tyrannosaur as a distraction while operatives steal specific poison dart frogs from the Reptile House. While Trinh-Norwood does not appear directly during the heist itself, the operation was designed to procure biological materials for her drug research. Mrs. Heartbeat escapes with some frogs, though Mr. Nothing and Mudslide are captured. Book 9: Sheol (Interlude LTN.2) Main (Interlude) Trinh-Norwood meets with Mr. Antithesis at his sterile skyscraper office in New York City's business district on a Sunday morning shortly after the zoo incident. She and Zenith discuss leaving Scylla outside before the meeting -- implying Mr. Antithesis's abilities are harmful to chimeras, which is never elaborated upon directly. Mr. Antithesis is described as cold and extremely brusque throughout the meeting. She presents Hypeman (Compound J-237), explaining its relationship to Jump's Compound A and revealing Jump's inner workings in detail: Compound A transmits powers but is unstable without a proper delivery system, and Jump requires extensive pharmacokinetics knowledge to prevent users from "folding in on themselves." She details how poison dart frog and bee hybrids create stable power-enhancing compounds, and that she has cultured cells from Daisy Zhen to create an analogous Compound B. She also reveals (to Mr. Antithesis and the reader) that Hypeman and Jump are fatally incompatible when mixed. She takes responsibility for Mr. Nothing and Mudslide's capture during Operation Ivory. Mr. Antithesis rewards her with a raise and a share of Hypeman's future profits but warns that further failures will not be tolerated. Book 10: Plume Mentioned Referenced when the Auditors discuss the Kingdom's operations and the implications of the stolen poison dart frogs. Hypeman begins appearing on Philadelphia's streets as a product of her research. Book 11: Alarm Will Sound Mentioned Hypeman autoinjectors feature prominently — Sam obtains two from Mr. Antithesis during negotiations and later uses one to survive being shot and thrown into the Delaware River. The drug's addictive properties and withdrawal symptoms (headaches, tremors) become significant plot points. Book 12: Authorized Personnel Only Mentioned Hypeman withdrawal continues to affect Sam. Tasha theorizes the drug was designed with addictive properties as a control mechanism. Hypeman continues appearing on streets. Sam's team investigates Kingdom drug operations. Book 13: Burn After Reading Supporting Present at the Daedalus prison break planning meeting at Bella Notte restaurant in Staten Island (Interlude BM.3), where Mr. Antithesis briefs Kingdom operatives on the Red Calf-contracted extraction of Deathgirl. Identifies a missing corridor in the Daedalus blueprints provided by Red Calf's Porcelain, raising concerns about the intelligence quality of the operation -- a detail that demonstrates her sharp analytical mind even outside her primary field of biology. Separately, Maya Richardson assigns Mr. Polygraph and Mr. Nothing to coordinate with Mrs. Xenograft on rebuilding Hypeman production in Camden (referenced in Interlude MR.7), indicating her continued operational importance to the Kingdom's drug infrastructure following the Stheno Pharmaceuticals warehouse destruction. Book 14: Shelter in Place Mentioned Shrike obtains a Hypeman autoinjector and uses it during the Van Kirk construction site battle against Sam, creating chaotic spike fields and injuring Bulwark. Trinh-Norwood's drug continues to circulate and cause harm beyond the Kingdom's direct control. Book 15: Severe Weather Warning Mentioned Vysera (daxerimab), a power suppressant drug created by Trinh-Norwood using an advancement of the Hypeman research combined with samples of Mr. Nothing's flesh, enters NSRA experimental trials. Derek Taylor enrolls in the Vysera trial to suppress his werewolf transformation, receiving 14 doses per week. Congress discusses using Vysera to depower inmates for transfer to regular prisons instead of Daedalus, raising ethical implications of chemical depowering as policy (Chapter 222). The drug represents a significant advancement in Trinh-Norwood's pharmaceutical work. Devonte mentions bringing in "Dr. M from Penn" to analyze Hypeman. Book 16: Category Five Hurricane Mentioned Her current status is described as "Busy." Vysera continues to be used in NSRA experimental trials, and Elias Franklin (Chimera) begins investigating the drug, suspecting it is derived from Snake Oil's Jump research.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Trinh-Norwood is insistent on the distinction between "mad zoologist" and "mad scientist," considering the latter inaccurate and the former a point of professional pride.
  • Within the Kingdom's alphabetical naming convention, she holds the "X" designation (Mrs. Xenograft / Mrs. X), though she prefers "Dr." to "Mrs." given her doctoral credentials.
  • Her companion Scylla is named after the sea monster from Greek mythology — a multi-limbed creature that was itself a hybrid of different animals.
  • Darwin, her glow-in-the-dark axolotl, is presumably named after Charles Darwin, the father of evolutionary biology.
  • She became distracted by a dying ficus plant during a high-level Kingdom strategy meeting about the Fly drug crisis.
  • The poison dart frogs stolen during Operation Ivory were a key ingredient in her development of Hypeman, as their toxins — when combined with bee hybrids — create stable power-enhancing compounds.
  • Vysera's generic name, daxerimab, follows the "-mab" suffix convention used for monoclonal antibody drugs, suggesting Trinh-Norwood designed it as a biological pharmaceutical rather than a simple chemical compound.
  • She is one of only a few Kingdom operatives to have had a direct, civil conversation with Sam Small outside of combat, during their unexpected zoo encounter.
  • LTN.1 reveals that before joining the Kingdom, Trinh-Norwood was supplementing her research income with barista work, a detail that underscores the gulf between her intellectual capabilities and her financial circumstances.
  • LTN.2 reveals Trinh-Norwood's deep understanding of Rogue Wave's Jump drug at a molecular level, including failure modes that cause users to "fold in on themselves" -- knowledge she leveraged to create a superior product in Hypeman.
  • Her identification of a missing corridor in the Daedalus blueprints during BM.3 demonstrates analytical competence that extends well beyond biology and pharmacology.
  • The coercive element of her recruitment in LTN.1 -- an explosive device disguised as a cigarette that detonates if conditions are not met -- is never fully resolved in the narrative. Whether the device was ever deactivated or whether she remains under its threat is left ambiguous.

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Liam O'Connor is a fifteen-year-old metahuman from a working-class Irish Catholic family in South Philadelphia. He lives in a rowhouse that has been in the O'Connor family for generations, sharing a bedroom with his younger brother. He is the middle child of five siblings, and his extended family is deeply integrated into the neighborhood, with cousins described as living on nearly every block. His father, Sean O'Connor, is a union electrician, and his mother, Bridget O'Connor, works part-time as a dental receptionist. Money is sometimes tight, but the family is boisterous and tight-knit, with strong connections to their local parish.

Liam first appeared as a member of Dr. Jensen's support group for traumatized superhumans, which Sam Small attended during her extended hospitalization in April 2024 following the Chernobyl confrontation. At that time, Liam was described as a teenage boy with a distant demeanor who found escape in fantasy novels. His specific powers were not disclosed during the group sessions, and Sam later admitted she could not remember what Liam's abilities were due to the fog of her lithium medication during that period.

When Councilman Jamal Davis proposed his peer mentorship program in late October 2025, Liam was identified as one of four initial cases alongside Zara Khan, Alex Kirby, and Jasmine Walker. He had been flagged by Dr. Jensen, likely due to the dramatic and potentially frightening nature of his draconic transformation in public settings, compounded by his Catholic family's initial religious panic upon witnessing his powers. The O'Connor family had initially feared that Liam's abilities were demonic in origin, a misconception that was eventually corrected. Liam attended his first formal mentorship session at the Parkway Central Library in early November 2025, where he was reunited with Sam and introduced to Maggie O'Brien as a peer mentor. By the time of the mentorship program's launch, Liam had grown significantly, having gained at least six inches in height since Sam last saw him in the therapy group.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Draconic Transformation (Full) — Liam can transform his entire body into a dragon form described as classic Slavic/European in style, resembling creatures from Chernobog or Lindwurm mythology rather than any Irish dragon tradition. The full transformation is extremely draining physically.
  • Partial Transformation — Liam can selectively transform individual limbs or body parts, such as producing black scales, claws, and horn-like protrusions on his arms. He describes the sensation as warm and pressure-like, as though something beneath the skin is pushing outward. As of the beginning of Arc 16, he can sustain partial dragon-arms for approximately two minutes while keeping his torso and legs in human form.
  • Hybrid Form — Liam can achieve an intermediate state between full human and full dragon, though the specifics and limitations of this form are not fully documented.
  • Eye Transformation — Liam can transform his eyes to a reptilian amber with slit pupils. He has demonstrated the ability to trigger this change nearly instantly, describing it as feeling increasingly natural with practice.
  • Smoke Emission — As a side effect of transformation, Liam exhales or emits smoke during periods of stress, anger, or intense focus. This involuntary emission led to a school incident in which he was reported for "exhaling smoke in a bathroom."

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Full draconic transformation is described as extremely draining, suggesting a significant energy cost that limits sustained use.
  • The transformation is described as somewhat scary-looking, making public use a practical liability.
  • Liam has experienced getting temporarily stuck in a partially transformed state, particularly with his dragon-eye form, requiring guided relaxation and focused breathing to revert. Sam has been working with him specifically on avoiding getting "stuck" in transformed states.
  • Scales can begin creeping beyond the intended area of transformation during loss of concentration, requiring active effort to contain.
  • Transformation can be triggered involuntarily by stress, anger, and certain types of music.
  • Smoke emission occurs involuntarily during emotional or physical strain, creating the risk of exposure in public settings.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Receiving ongoing power control training through the mentorship program, with Sam Small as his primary trainer. Exercises focus on maintaining partial transformation during distractions, using rapid-fire questions to simulate real-world interruption.
  • Learned personalized grounding and de-escalation techniques: controlled breathing (inhale through the nose, exhale through the mouth, counting to four) as an emergency reversion method.
  • Has expressed interest in becoming an electrician, following his father's trade.
  • Uses his powers casually for household tasks and has impressed classmates with demonstrations, though his peers are described as mostly bored of it by now.
  • Trained in de-escalation doctrine taught by Sam at the community center: do not engage Songbirds or provocateurs, understand the strategic difference between defensive and offensive use of powers, and recognize the political consequences of powered individuals harming civilians.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Liam is characterized as the "good brash" counterpart to Alex Kirby's romantic brashness. He has a squeaky voice that is still cracking, and he carries himself as a teenager in the process of figuring things out, beginning to rebel in safe and measured ways rather than dramatic ones. He is well-liked despite average academics, possessing a natural humor and a willingness to stand up for others even when they annoy him. At his core, Liam wants good things for the world, his family, and his friends.

His personality reflects his upbringing in a large, loud, tightly bonded family. He is not quiet or withdrawn, but neither is he reckless. Where Alex Kirby gravitates toward grand gestures and dramatic action, Liam's brashness is grounded and practical, shaped by a working-class environment where people speak directly and look out for one another. His initial fear that his powers were demonic speaks to the depth of his Catholic upbringing's influence, but his willingness to learn and adapt once corrected demonstrates a fundamentally open and good-natured disposition.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Liam's dragon form follows Slavic/European dragon mythology (Chernobog/Lindwurm tradition), which is deliberately not Irish despite his Irish Catholic background.
  • The correction of his family's belief that his powers were demonic is memorialized with the blunt quote: "Dragons have long necks, demons don't, idiot."
  • He rides an undersized bicycle, a detail noted when he departs from the Franklin Park training session.
  • Liam's sister Erin has sold Maggie weed, a minor detail that connects the O'Connor family's social network to the Auditors through an unexpected channel.
  • McNulty of Pattinson's Pals knows the O'Connor family personally, indicating the family is well-known within South Philadelphia's community networks. McNulty's comment to Sam, praising her work with "the O'Connors' kid," represents a rare point of overlap between the Pals and the mentorship program.
  • His school reported him for "exhaling smoke in the bathroom," which was actually an involuntary side effect of his dragon transformation rather than any conventional misbehavior.
  • Liam was the catalyst for Jasmine Walker's power reveal: his accidental slip during training caused Jasmine's protective chlorokinesis to activate for the first time in front of the group.
  • He has expressed interest in following his father into the electrician trade, one of the few mentorship students with a concrete career aspiration outside of superheroics.

docs.title: Lily Chen
docs.text: Chinese-American speedster and core member of the Auditors, formerly of the Young Defenders, who uses acceleration manipulation for high-speed mobility and precision ranged attacks.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Lily Chen Aliases Blink, Powerwash (undercover alias) Date of Birth Unknown (approximately 2006) Age 17–19 Gender Female Ethnicity Chinese-American Place of Birth Unknown Residence Bridesburg, Philadelphia, PA (family rowhome on Almond Street) Affiliation Auditors Former Affiliations Young Defenders Occupation Superhero, College Student Status Active First Appearance Chapter 5 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Lily Chen is a superhuman who gained the ability to manipulate acceleration through touch. She was initially assessed by PERKS in 2021 at approximately age 15, receiving a provisional JLUMA (juvenile license) with required monthly check-ins. Her interviewing officer, Michael Reynolds, encouraged her to join the Young Defenders, where she could train alongside peers and develop her abilities in a structured environment.

As a member of the Young Defenders, Lily served primarily as a mobility asset, using her inline skates and acceleration powers to achieve speeds faster than most cars. When Sam Small's home in Mayfair was destroyed by Mr. Tyrannosaur, Lily and her family took Sam in, hosting her at their modest rowhome on Almond Street in Bridesburg for several months. Her parents, Mei and Jiang Chen, run the Golden Panda Buffet and are aware of their daughter's superhero activities.

Following the passage of Mayor Maya Richardson's anti-vigilante legislation in 2025, the Young Defenders faced dissolution. While some members chose to comply or transition to government-aligned teams, Lily refused to quit and joined the Auditors alongside Sam Small. She adopted the undercover alias "Powerwash" during the team's gambit against the Kingdom of Keys on the Tacony-Palmyra Bridge. As of early 2026, Lily continues to serve as the Auditors' primary transport and quick-response operative while attending college.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: Field Value Classification A4/S/P/T Category Adjust Power Ranking 4/10 Control 6/10 Hostility 0/10 Collateral Damage 4/10 Threat Level 3/10

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Acceleration Doubling — Doubles the acceleration vector of any object she is in physical contact with along a single axis per activation. The effect lasts for one second and does not inherently revert, meaning acceleration continues naturally unless countered by external forces such as friction, drag, or counterthrust. Can apply this effect once per second per target.
  • High-Speed Mobility — Primary application of her power is personal acceleration while skating on inline skates, allowing her to achieve speeds faster than most cars. Uses urban traversal techniques such as skitching onto vehicles and propelling herself off solid surfaces.
  • Enhanced Striking Power — Applies acceleration boosts to objects mid-flight to significantly increase their impact force. Frequently employs this with her slingshot and meteor hammer for precision ranged attacks and non-lethal takedowns.
  • Kinetic Disruption — Selectively boosts acceleration of objects to manipulate the balance of adversaries, knocking them off course or disrupting their movement.
  • Fast Fall / Gravity Spike — Doubles the force of gravity downward on herself or a grappled opponent to spike them into the ground or rapidly descend.
  • Vehicle Acceleration — Can boost the acceleration of vehicles she is in contact with.
  • Perceptual Object Unity — Her power functions based on her cognitive perception of an object as a single entity, allowing her to apply acceleration to composite objects like inline skates or a meteor hammer as cohesive units.
  • Anomalous Biological Reinforcement — Possesses an anomalous physical resilience that mitigates the effects of sudden acceleration shifts, allowing her to function under conditions that would incapacitate a normal human. This effect has limits and extreme acceleration stacking may exceed her tolerance threshold.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Touch Requirement — Must maintain physical contact with an object to apply her ability, making it ineffective for long-range applications without projectiles.
  • Single Axis Per Activation — Can only double acceleration along one axis (horizontal or vertical) per use.
  • Once Per Second Per Target — Cannot stack multiple boosts on the same object within one second.
  • Diminishing Returns — Air resistance and surface friction place practical limits on acceleration stacking, as objects at high velocities encounter increasing drag.
  • Cognitive Load — Practical use requires precise timing, particularly when applying boosts to moving objects. Her own ability to perceive and respond to increased acceleration imposes limits on safe maximum velocity.
  • G-Force Tolerance — Unlike natural speedsters, she does not receive automatic protection from all physical strain of high-speed movement. Extreme acceleration stacking may exceed her biological tolerance.
  • Limited Physics Understanding — Does not fully grasp the mathematics of acceleration physics, which limits her ability to optimize her power's effectiveness.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Trained with the Young Defenders in field operations, team coordination, and combat tactics.
  • Proficient with slingshot, achieving sniper-like precision when combined with her acceleration power.
  • Skilled with a meteor hammer, used both as a weapon and as a demonstration tool for de-escalation.
  • Experienced in urban traversal and high-speed skating maneuvers.
  • Currently learning boxing fundamentals from Sam Small, though more comfortable with weapons than empty-hand combat.
  • Capable of independent intelligence gathering, leveraging her family's restaurant as a source of information from local police officers and community members.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Lily is good-natured, optimistic, and energetic, bringing an unembellished enthusiasm to her team interactions. She is not the most intellectually sharp member of any group she belongs to, but this quality gives her a disarming earnestness that serves a valuable function. Her tendency to ask clarifying questions when she does not understand something can lead to eureka moments for her teammates or, occasionally, waste time. She has a knack for cutting through overthinking and getting straight to the point.

She possesses a strong personal moral code against lethal force and demonstrates restraint and situational awareness in combat. Her PERKS assessments consistently note her altruistic nature and zero hostility toward state actors or the public. Despite being characterized as reckless in her earlier years, particularly regarding high-speed maneuvering, she has matured into a competent and reliable operative capable of handling crises independently, as demonstrated when she managed a Songbird confrontation at the community center without violence.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Her PERKS classification was originally categorized as H3/G2 (Hopper/Gigant) before being reclassified to A4 (Adjust) in 2023 following further analysis by the NSRA.
  • Her power assessment was conducted by Dr. Leonard Harris, a specialist in metahuman power assessment for the National Superhuman Response Agency.
  • Her interviewing officer noted that she expressed interest in understanding the physics behind her power but suspected she would ask her teammates to handle the calculations for her.
  • The character reference guide describes her as "the least intelligent person in the room" without Connor around, but frames this as a source of her good-natured energy rather than a deficiency.
  • Her family's rowhome features a futon in the living room where Sam slept during her months-long stay, along with mismatched furniture including a milk crate coffee table.
  • She adopted the alias "Powerwash" as part of "The Washes," a fake villain team consisting of herself, Amelia (as "Brainwash"), and Kate Smith (as "Mouthwash") during the Kingdom gambit.
  • Her current status as of the beginning of Arc 16 is described as "still the transport" for the Auditors.
  • A young superhuman named Liam O'Connor recognized Lily from Young Defenders operations three years prior when meeting her at the Auditors' mentorship program.

docs.title: Lucas Donovan
docs.text: Founding member and co-lead interrogator of the Kingdom of Keys' Philadelphia branch, known for his lie-detection abilities and volatile temperament masked by professional composure.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Lucas Donovan Aliases Mr. Polygraph, Mr. P, Agent Parker Date of Birth September 15, 1985 Age 38-39 Gender Male Ethnicity Caucasian Place of Birth Trenton, NJ Residence Philadelphia, PA Affiliation Kingdom of Keys (Philadelphia Branch) Former Affiliations Unnamed Philadelphia criminal gang (2010-2016); freelance criminal interrogator (2016-2019) Occupation Co-Lead Interrogator, Kingdom of Keys Status Incarcerated (depowered) First Appearance Chapter 12 Last Appearance Ongoing (referenced)

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Lucas Donovan was born on September 15, 1985, in Trenton, New Jersey, to Victoria and Raymond Donovan. He grew up in a household characterized by dishonesty and maintained appearances, an environment that would prove formative in shaping both his temperament and his eventual relationship with his metahuman abilities. His power first manifested on June 17, 2001, during a family dinner when he experienced an itching sensation in his skull as his father lied about his whereabouts the previous night. This initial activation event tied Lucas's abilities directly to the domestic deceptions that defined his upbringing.

After relocating to Philadelphia in 2007, Lucas worked as a bartender, quietly using his nascent lie-detection abilities to identify patrons who were cheating or running scams. By 2010, he had drifted into organized crime, joining a small-time criminal gang where he earned the nickname "Polygraph" for his uncanny ability to identify deception. His powers proved invaluable during gang operations, most notably in 2012 when he uncovered a planned double-cross that saved the group from a disastrous outcome. When the gang disbanded following a major police crackdown in 2016, Lucas freelanced his interrogation services throughout Philadelphia's criminal underworld.

On October 31, 2019, Mr. Antithesis approached Lucas and offered him the role of lead interrogator for the newly forming Kingdom of Keys. Lucas accepted, formally adopting the designation "Mr. Polygraph" and cultivating a more professional appearance to align with the organization's corporate criminal ethos. As a founding member of the Kingdom, he became instrumental in vetting recruits, maintaining internal security, and conducting interrogations alongside his partner, Mr. Nothing (Darnell Hayes). The two operated as the Philadelphia branch's co-lead interrogators, a role that placed Lucas at the center of the Kingdom's intelligence operations for several years until his capture and depowering by Rogue Wave in late 2025.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text: • Lie Detection (Spoken Word) — Lucas possesses an extrasensory ability to determine whether someone is truthfully responding to a question he asks. When a subject speaks a falsehood, he experiences a distinct unpleasant twinge, referred to as a "ping," in the back of his skull. This ability functions regardless of physical proximity and operates over telephone calls, video calls, and any other medium that transmits spoken communication. The power detects subjective truth rather than objective reality, meaning it registers whether the speaker believes they are telling a falsehood rather than whether the statement is factually accurate. This nuance allows Lucas to identify individuals who are unknowingly spreading misinformation, as their genuine belief in the falsehood would not trigger a ping. Conversely, someone who believes they are lying but happens to state something factually true would still trigger the sensation.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• The ability requires spoken communication to function and is completely ineffective against written statements, non-verbal cues, or text-based deception.
  • Clever wordplay, half-truths, and statements that are technically correct but misleading can circumvent the power, as the subjective belief component may not register these as falsehoods.
  • The physical manifestation of the ping as a skull sensation can become distracting or overwhelming in environments where multiple lies are being told simultaneously, requiring significant mental discipline to manage during complex interrogations.
  • Recorded playback of another person's voice does not trigger the power, as demonstrated during the Soot sting operation when the Auditors used Devonte's sound-replaying abilities to feed Kate's pre-recorded voice through Sam's mask, bypassing Lucas's detection entirely.
  • Following his capture by Rogue Wave, Snake Oil extracted Lucas's lie-detection power through direct physical contact, crystallizing it into a blue-green substance over approximately 90 seconds. This left Lucas permanently depowered. As of the beginning of Arc 16, Mr. Antithesis is actively hunting Fly to provide Lucas with a replacement power, and it is implied he has re-acquired a new ability, though its nature has not yet been revealed.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• One of the best marksmen in the Kingdom of Keys among members whose powers do not enhance their aim. He is consistently described as a crack shot with firearms.
  • Excellent chess player, reflecting his strategic intelligence and capacity for anticipating opponents' moves.
  • Genuinely intelligent, capable of running complex interrogations that blend psychological pressure with his supernatural abilities.
  • Skilled in intimidation and psychological manipulation, employing threats of extreme violence (such as Yakuza-style finger removal) to extract compliance even without using his power.
  • Practiced meditator, using breathing techniques to manage his anger issues and maintain composure during high-pressure interrogations.
  • Experienced in impersonating law enforcement, having successfully posed as NSRA Agent Parker with fabricated credentials during the Hatboro-Horsham investigation.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Lucas Donovan presents as professional and controlled, maintaining a composed exterior that belies significant anger management issues simmering beneath the surface. He is impulsive in his thinking but disciplined in his actions, possessing the self-awareness to lid his volatile impulses most of the time. When that lid slips, the results are explosive: he has been observed firing his gun into machinery in frustration, breaking a subordinate's nose as a substitute for cutting off his finger, and escalating confrontations beyond what the tactical situation requires. His rage appears rooted in a deep-seated frustration with dishonesty, a trait likely exacerbated by a power that forces him to confront untruths constantly.

In his professional capacity, Lucas is direct, authoritative, and comfortable exercising lethal force. He executed a suspected informant with two gunshots during a recruitment meeting on Halloween to silence dissent and demonstrate consequences. He assigned Aaron McKinley to kill Bloodhound as casually as delegating a work task. Yet he is not purely sadistic; he simply operates within the Kingdom's framework of criminal pragmatism, treating violence as a business tool rather than a source of personal pleasure. Outside of work, Lucas is described as someone who simply has his life and lives it, with interests in classic detective novels, jazz music, poker, and a collection of vintage polygraph machines that reflects his respect for the tradition of lie detection.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Darnell Hayes (Mr. Nothing) Partner / Close friend Co-lead interrogator and operational partner for the Philadelphia branch. The two form an inseparable duo described as "heterosexual life mates," despite having met only relatively recently through the Kingdom. They complement each other tactically: Lucas provides intelligence-gathering through lie detection while Darnell provides power nullification in the field. Trent Fairfax (Mr. Antithesis) Superior / Benefactor Leader of the Kingdom of Keys who recruited Lucas as a founding member in 2019. Following Lucas's depowering, Mr. Antithesis personally undertook a campaign to acquire Fly to restore Lucas's abilities, demonstrating the organization's investment in his value. Maya Richardson (Mrs. Zenith) Colleague Acting boss of the Philadelphia branch. Maya coordinated Lucas's legal representation following his arrest and visited him in the hospital after his depowering. She assigned him and Mr. Nothing to oversee Hypeman production coordination with Mrs. Xenograft. Sam Small (Bloodhound) Adversary Teenage vigilante who became Lucas's most persistent antagonist. Their encounters escalated from the Dobson Factory confrontation through the NSRA impersonation to the Soot sting, culminating in Sam orchestrating the tip that led to his capture and depowering by Rogue Wave. Aaron McKinley (The Coyote) Subordinate Low-level criminal whom Lucas intimidated and then assigned to assassinate Bloodhound as repayment for lost Kingdom funds. Blake Matthews (Mr. Tyrannosaur) Colleague Kingdom enforcer. Lucas socialized with him outside of operations, inviting him to a strip club after a Kingdom meeting, and the two met jointly with Aaron McKinley to collect debts. Maria Valdez (Mrs. Heartbeat) Colleague Kingdom assassin and medic who accompanied Lucas during the Halloween warehouse recruitment meeting and the zoo heist operation.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 1: Pup Supporting First appears in Chapter 12 alongside Mr. Nothing and Mudslide at the abandoned Dobson Textile Factory. Interrogates a captive about connections to Liberty Belle while overseeing Mudslide's loyalty test, which results in the captive's murder. Discovers Sam Small and Jordan Westwood observing from the catwalks. Interrogates Sam at gunpoint, revealing his lie-detection abilities and threatening to shoot her if she lies. Fires his gun wildly in frustration when Sam bluffs about streaming audio, allowing the teens to escape. Engages in a brutal fight in Chapter 13, during which Sam bites his shoulder and punches him repeatedly. Appears in drone footage presented to the Delaware Valley Defenders as evidence of Kingdom criminal activity. Book 2: Keys Mentioned Referenced as a subject in the drone footage shown to the adult Delaware Valley Defenders by the Young Defenders team. The footage of the Dobson Factory murder becomes key evidence identifying the Kingdom of Keys as a criminal organization. Book 3: Dybbuk Supporting Leads the Halloween night recruitment meeting at the Kingdom warehouse on Trenton Avenue alongside Mrs. Heartbeat. Addresses recruits, explains the initiation test requiring them to convert stolen goods into $20,000 by mid-December, and threatens to shoot any undercover officers. Executes a suspected informant with two gunshots (one to the head, one to the chest) to demonstrate the consequences of betrayal. This event is witnessed by Sam, Jordan, Jamila, and Spinelli, who are hiding inside the warehouse. Video footage of his address is later presented to the Delaware Valley Defenders as evidence. Referenced in Sam's thoughts during subsequent chapters as a looming threat. Book 4: Exorcism Supporting Appears in the AMK.1 interlude alongside Mr. Tyrannosaur. Summons Aaron McKinley to demand repayment of lost Kingdom funds. Threatens to cut off Aaron's pinky finger in a Yakuza-style punishment, terrorizing him with a knife before instead breaking his nose with a punch. Reveals that the Kingdom has identified "Wolf" as Bloodhound, a junior cape interfering with their operations. Assigns Aaron to kill Bloodhound as a means of redeeming himself. Appears in Chapter 57 posing as NSRA Agent Parker alongside Mr. ESP (Agent Evans) at the Hatboro-Horsham NSRA crime scene. His arm shows injuries from his previous encounter with Sam. Interrogates the teens about their presence, growing increasingly specific and suspicious. Triggers Spindle's recognition by using the word "fruitful" from their Halloween encounter. Sam deliberately lies to trigger his powers and test his reactions. Falters when Sam questions his specific reference to abandoned buildings, confirming Kingdom surveillance of their activities. Pulled away by Agent Evans after the confrontation escalates. Photograph taken by Sam becomes evidence of Kingdom members impersonating federal officers. Later shown in video evidence to NSRA Agent Torres during intelligence sharing. Book 5: Mayfly Supporting (Interlude) Appears in the BM.1 interlude (Mr. Tyrannosaur's POV) at a Kingdom leadership meeting. Arrives visibly injured from a recent assault by Fly-powered attackers ("gutter punks"). Reports on the emergence of the Fly drug and its implications. References the recent Chernobyl/Fedorov failure. Treats his injuries at the first aid station. Invites Mr. Tyrannosaur to unwind at a strip club afterward, and they depart Kingdom headquarters together in a Cadillac. Book 7: Security Mentioned Referenced in discussions about the Kingdom's potential interest in the Philadelphia Zoo and their operational planning. His role as interrogator is part of the broader Kingdom threat assessment during Arc 7. Book 8: Big Mentioned Not directly present during the zoo heist (Operation Ivory), which was led by Mr. Nothing, Mrs. Heartbeat, Mudslide, and Mr. Tyrannosaur. Referenced as part of the Kingdom's operational structure during the arc's events. Mr. Nothing and Mudslide are captured at the conclusion of the zoo battle. Book 10: Plume Supporting (Interlude) Assigned by Maya Richardson alongside Mr. Nothing to coordinate with Mrs. Xenograft on rebuilding Hypeman production in Camden, as detailed in the MR.7 interlude following the Soot sting operation. Part of the strategic planning discussion at the Kingdom safehouse regarding Rogue Wave's silence and anti-vigilante legislation expansion. Book 11: Alarm Will Sound Supporting Present during the Soot sting operation (the Washes operation) alongside Mr. Retribution, Mrs. Quiet, and Mr. Nothing. Arrives at Lardner's Point Park and offers $2,000 to the Washes for first interrogation rights. Questions the disguised Sam about her knowledge of the Trenton Avenue warehouse. Demands to see "Soot's" face to confirm identity, threatening to expose the entire deception. His lie-detection powers are bypassed during the interrogation because Sam was not actually speaking; Devonte's sound-replaying ability was feeding Kate's pre-recorded voice through the mask. A police siren diversion prevents him from unmasking Sam. Book 15: Severe Weather Warning Supporting Captured in the Rogue Wave operation at Roxborough Memorial Hospital. Sam tips off Rogue Wave about the Kingdom's evidence disposal, and Monkey Business correctly predicts Lucas's involvement. Lucas and Mr. Nothing arrive to investigate, where they are ambushed by Rogue Wave's combat team (Rush Order, Birthday Suit, Dead Drop). Rush Order captures Lucas, and he is transported to a secondary location in Camden where Snake Oil performs the power extraction, placing his hand on Lucas's neck after administering local anesthetic. Over 90 seconds, Lucas's lie-detection power materializes as a blue-green crystal, leaving him permanently depowered. Rogue Wave tips police about his location 45 minutes later. He is found at Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital in Camden, traumatized but physically unharmed, with attorney Catherine Giuliano present. Maya Richardson visits him that evening. Mr. Antithesis subsequently announces that Lucas will lose his "Mr. Polygraph" designation but maintain his salary, territory, and operational authority, pledging to acquire Fly to restore his abilities. The operation results in 19 total arrests, including Lucas, transforming Sam from a "tactical nuisance" to a "strategic problem" in the Kingdom's assessment. Book 16: Category Five Hurricane Mentioned Referenced as going through the legal system following his arrest. Mr. Antithesis is personally involved in hunting Rogue Wave to acquire Fly for Lucas's re-powering. It is implied that Lucas has re-acquired a new power, though its nature has not been revealed.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Lucas received a toy lie detector for Christmas in 1990 at age five, an early spark for his lifelong fascination with truth and deception.
  • He maintains a collection of vintage polygraph machines, fascinated by the history and evolution of mechanical lie detection technology.
  • Lucas is an avid poker player who used his powers to detect bluffs, giving him a significant edge at the table.
  • He enjoys classic detective novels, particularly those featuring Sherlock Holmes and Hercule Poirot, characters renowned for penetrating deception.
  • His fondness for classic jazz music is noted as a relaxation habit during downtime, and the connection between jazz improvisation and authentic expression may parallel his power's relationship to spoken truth.
  • He was the first Kingdom member to physically encounter Sam Small, establishing the adversarial relationship between the Kingdom and the protagonist that would drive much of the story's central conflict.
  • The "Agent Parker" alias he used while impersonating an NSRA agent was paired with badge number 7742.
  • His power extraction by Snake Oil produced a blue-green crystal, which was subsequently processed into Fly, the metahuman drug distributed by Rogue Wave.
  • Lawrence Sullivan (Monkey Business), the leader of Rogue Wave, acquired Lucas's lie-detection power after having Snake Oil extract it, making Sullivan the current wielder of the ability Lucas lost.
  • He and Darnell Hayes (Mr. Nothing) are described as "heterosexual life mates" in the Kevin Smith sense, despite having only met when the Kingdom was founded.

docs.title: Lucy King
docs.text: Leader of the Tacony Titans and psychometric investigator whose time-perception abilities make her one of Northeast Philadelphia's most effective vigilante strategists.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Lucy King Aliases Sundial Date of Birth Unknown Age 21 Gender Female Ethnicity Blasian (Black and Asian mixed heritage) Place of Birth Unknown (native to Tacony) Residence Tacony, Philadelphia, PA Affiliation Tacony Titans (Leader) Former Affiliations N/A Occupation Vigilante, Investigator (also presumably attending school or working) Status Active First Appearance Chapter 70 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Lucy King is a mixed Blasian metahuman who grew up in Tacony, a neighborhood in Northeast Philadelphia, within a middle-class family with high expectations. She operates under the alias Sundial and leads the Tacony Titans, a team of young heroes who serve as the defensive, community-oriented counterpart to the Auditors in the Northeast Philadelphia vigilante ecosystem. Prior to her on-page introduction, the Tacony Titans had already established enough of a local presence to maintain a basic website listing their members, which Sam Small's school friends discovered during an online search in September 2023.

Lucy and the Titans first appeared in person in late April 2024, when Sam Small and Jordan Westwood encountered Sundial and Bubble intervening in a drunken dispute at Wissinoming Park during one of Sam's first patrols after her hospitalization. Sundial demonstrated immediate competence, neutralizing the threat with an aikido technique before formal introductions revealed the team's name. She suggested that future collaboration between their groups could be "mutually beneficial," establishing the cautious, professional tone that would define her relationship with the Auditors going forward.

Lucy's role expanded significantly when she approached Sam after the failed sting operation on Squeal in early May 2024, proposing a formal alliance between the Titans and the Auditors to address the growing drug crisis in Philadelphia. This alliance proved critical in subsequent operations against the Jump distribution network and remained a cornerstone of the Northeast Philadelphia vigilante infrastructure through subsequent arcs. Lucy balances her leadership of the Titans with independent investigative work, often assisting the Delaware Valley Defenders and local law enforcement with cases that benefit from her psychometric abilities.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Psychometry — Lucy can "read" locations by experiencing events that occurred there up to 24 hours in the past. This manifests as a sensory movie, allowing her to witness past actions in detail sufficient to identify individuals, describe their behavior, and reconstruct timelines. She used this ability to confirm Aaron McKinley as the arsonist behind the Philadelphia fire crisis by reading the burned coffee shop site, and to investigate Jump distribution operations at the Sunoco station in Tacony.
  • Short-Range Precognition — Can perceive up to five seconds into the future, granting her a significant advantage in combat and tactical situations. She displayed momentary precognitive awareness during the Dobson Mills warehouse stakeout and uses this ability in conjunction with her martial arts training to anticipate and counter attacks.
  • Precognition Chaining — Can extend her precognitive window indefinitely by "chaining" successive five-second glimpses into a continuous vision of the future. However, this locks her physically to the area where the chaining began; she cannot leave until the predicted timeframe has passed, as departing would create causality issues. She is physically unable to move from the location during this process.
  • Photographic Memory — Possesses total recall, which enhances both her investigative capabilities and her ability to provide detailed intelligence. This ability allowed her to produce an accurate sketch of Aaron McKinley from her psychometric vision, which was subsequently broadcast on the news and confirmed Aaron's identity.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Lucy's powers are perception-based and provide no physical enhancements; she is a baseline human in terms of durability, strength, and recovery.
  • Psychometry is limited to a 24-hour window and requires her physical presence at the location she wishes to read.
  • Precognition chaining, while theoretically indefinite, renders her immobile and vulnerable for the duration of the predicted timeframe.
  • She was injured during the Dobson Mills warehouse battle, requiring Bubble's protective force fields and Sam's direct intervention to keep her safe.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Highly skilled aikido practitioner who combines her martial art with precognitive awareness to create an extremely effective close-combat fighting style. She neutralized a threat at Wissinoming Park with a single technique during her first on-page appearance and demonstrated skilled combat against armed opponents at the Sunoco station confrontation.
  • Accomplished illustrator, capable of producing accurate sketches from her psychometric visions. Her drawing of Aaron McKinley was detailed enough to be used as an identification tool on news broadcasts.
  • Experienced investigator who regularly assists the Delaware Valley Defenders and local police with cases, leveraging her psychometry to reconstruct crime scenes and identify perpetrators.
  • Competent team leader and strategic coordinator, managing the Tacony Titans' operations and facilitating multi-team alliances across Philadelphia's vigilante community.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Lucy is pragmatic, professional, and methodical in her approach to both leadership and fieldwork. She maintains a calm, formal demeanor under pressure and speaks with a directness that conveys authority without aggression. Her perfectionist streak manifests in thorough preparation and a preference for evidence-gathering over impulsive action. She is emotionally reserved, rarely displaying vulnerability even when situations deteriorate, and channels her commitment to the Titans' mission through careful planning rather than overt displays of passion.

Beneath her composed exterior, Lucy possesses a sharp wit and a willingness to make blunt assessments. She dismissively referred to Miss Mayfly as "Mosquito" during the post-Ricochet confrontation, made casual inquiries about Crossroads' personal life in the same scene, and warned Team Mayfly plainly about the inevitability of injuries if they continued field operations without powers. She is deeply committed to the safety of her teammates and the broader vigilante community, proposing inter-team coordination and mutual protection strategies in response to the Argus Corps' anti-vigilante initiatives. Her leadership style prioritizes defensive, reactive operations -- the Titans are described as "the boy scouts of Tacony" -- in contrast to the Auditors' more aggressive approach, a distinction she has noted directly when referencing Sam's violence-oriented methods.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Sam Small (Bloodhound) Ally / Fellow Leader Leader-to-leader relationship built on mutual respect and strategic cooperation. Lucy proposed the initial alliance between their teams and serves as a regular point of contact for intelligence sharing. She has commented on Sam's tendency toward violence but maintains a productive working relationship. Joshua Clark (Sandman) Teammate / Second-in-Command The Titans' second-in-command. Sandman provided covert surveillance of Sam's neighborhood during the arson crisis and serves as the team's night watchman and tactical planner. Rosa Acosta (Bubble) Teammate The youngest Titan and the team's defensive specialist. Bubble attempted to protect Lucy when she was injured during the Dobson Mills warehouse battle. Lucy instructed Bubble to flee during that confrontation. Natasha Sokolov (Compass) Teammate The Titans' navigator and tech specialist. Compass arrived with Moonshot to support Lucy's investigation at the burned coffee shop. Considered moving operations underground in response to the Safer Streets Initiative. Min-ji Kim (Moonshot) Teammate The Titans' bruiser and oldest member. Moonshot arrived as reinforcement during the Ricochet battle and provided support during the arson investigation. Maxwell Martinez (Crossroads) Professional Contact Leader of the Young Defenders. Lucy made casual inquiries about his leadership style and personal life during the post-Ricochet confrontation, suggesting professional interest in his methods. Crossroads instructed her and Moonshot to return to patrol after the battle. Kate Smith (Miss Mayfly) Acquaintance Lucy dismissively nicknamed her "Mosquito" and warned about the dangers of unpowered individuals participating in field operations. The Titans helped devise a cover story to protect Kate's identity after the Dobson Mills battle.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 2: Keys Mentioned The Tacony Titans are referenced during a gathering at Kate's house in September 2023. Lilly mentions them as a local superhero team her father encountered, and the group views the Titans' basic website listing members including Sundial. Book 5: Mayfly Supporting First on-page appearance in Chapter 70, where Sundial and Bubble are observed handling a drunken dispute at Wissinoming Park. Sundial neutralizes the threat with an aikido technique and suggests future collaboration with the Auditors. Arrives as reinforcement during the Ricochet battle in Chapter 72. In Chapter 73, makes casual inquiries about Crossroads and dismisses Miss Mayfly as "Mosquito." Proposes a formal alliance with the Auditors in Chapter 79 after independently investigating the drug problem. Leads the Titans in the alliance formation meeting at their garage headquarters in Chapter 80. Displays precognitive awareness during the Dobson Mills stakeout. Injured during the ensuing warehouse battle in Chapter 81, protected by Bubble and assisted by Sam. Warns about risks of unlicensed vigilantism during the aftermath in Chapter 82. Warns Team Mayfly about field operation dangers and helps negotiate their limited role in Chapter 83. Participates in the final Sparkplug confrontation in Chapter 84. Book 8: Big Supporting Attends the combined briefing at the Music Hall with Sandman, sharing intelligence about the Kingdom's planned zoo heist. Sam meets with Sundial and Manta Rei at a cafe near UPenn to share information about the zoo operation. Book 9: Sheol Supporting Uses psychometry to investigate the burned coffee shop site in Chapter 140, providing a detailed description of the arsonist matching Aaron McKinley. Produces a sketch of Aaron that is broadcast on the news, confirming his identity. Offers to have Sandman watch Sam's neighborhood. Arrives with Moonshot and Compass to provide additional support during the investigation. Book 10: Plume Mentioned The Tacony Titans assist with covering neighborhood patrols while Sam is grounded, maintaining community protection in the Auditors' reduced capacity. Book 12: Authorized Personnel Only Supporting Lucy arrives at an Auditors training session behind the Music Hall and pulls Sam aside to discuss urgent team business. Reports that Bubble was caught by police and warns about Patriot's "Safer Streets Initiative" offering $500 bounties for reporting powered youth. Suggests coordinating between hero teams for mutual protection and proposes reaching out to Pattinson's Pals despite ideological differences. Mentions Jump activity on the east side before departing. The Tacony Titans are identified as one of three major vigilante factions operating in Philadelphia alongside the Auditors and Pattinson's Pals. Book 13: Burn After Reading Mentioned Moonshot is observed intervening in a mugging while Sam watches, restricted by parental curfew rules. The Tacony Titans continue operating in Northeast Philadelphia. Book 14: Shelter in Place Mentioned The Tacony Titans report spotting a tall, thin figure in dark clothes dropping birds during the Shrike crisis but lose pursuit. The team contributes to the broader investigation into the escalating bird-killing pattern. Book 15: Severe Weather Warning Supporting Lily contacts Lucy to arrange a meeting regarding the Jump distribution investigation. Sundial agrees to meet despite a busy schedule. Accompanies Sam, Maggie, and Lily on the Sunoco station infiltration, using psychometry to confirm Marathon's identity and observe past drug transactions. Demonstrates skilled combat against armed opponents when Marathon's crew returns. Escapes with Maggie when Sam is captured by Drop, then circles back with the team to assist in Sam's extraction. Sam uses the threat of Sundial's psychometry as a tactical deterrent against Marathon's plan to bomb the Bellwether site. Sam distributes intelligence to Sundial as part of her intel distribution circuit. Sundial responds first to Sam's Bellwether message. During the targeted blizzard in Chapter 229, Sundial requests the Auditors' help as the Titans are overwhelmed with search and rescue operations across Northeast Philadelphia, reporting 15 commercial break-ins overnight in the Kingdom's expansion zone. Her surname (King) is revealed for the first time. Book 16: Category Five Hurricane Supporting A joint communication channel is established between the Titans and Auditors to coordinate the ongoing response to Kingdom territorial expansion. Sam proposes involving Sundial for temporal intelligence in planned operations against the Bellwether site.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• The Tacony Titans operated a basic website listing their members before any on-page appearance, discovered by Sam's friends in September 2023. The original roster listed on the site included Bubble, Compass, Weave, Sandman, and Sundial -- Weave was later apparently replaced by Moonshot on the team.
  • Lucy dismissively referred to Miss Mayfly as "Mosquito," a nickname that stuck among the Titans, with Bubble also expressing dislike for the "mosquito" prior to Kate's identity being known.
  • Sam used the mere threat of Sundial's psychometry to talk Marathon out of bombing the Bellwether drug operation, marking the first tactical use of the Titans' powers as leverage without Lucy even being present.
  • When Sam sent out the Bellwether intelligence message to all her contacts, Sundial was the first to respond, replying simply with "When and where?"
  • Lucy's current status as of the beginning of Arc 16 is listed as "N/A, presumably working and handling school," making her one of the few characters whose civilian life remains largely undetailed.
  • The Tacony Titans operate out of a garage headquarters, in contrast to the Auditors' Music Hall and later Community Center.
  • Lucy's fighting style -- aikido combined with precognition -- makes her one of the most technically skilled martial artists in the story, capable of neutralizing threats with minimal force.

docs.title: Magdalene "Maggie" O'Brien
docs.text: Teenage force field user and core member of the Auditors, mentored by Sam Small after being rescued during the Phreaks crisis.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Magdalene O'Brien Aliases Flashpoint Date of Birth Unknown Age 16 Gender Female Ethnicity Irish-American (Irish Catholic) Place of Birth Unknown Residence South Philadelphia, PA Affiliation Auditors Former Affiliations N/A Occupation Student, Vigilante Status Active First Appearance Chapter 106 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Magdalene "Maggie" O'Brien is a teenage metahuman who gained her powers after being caught in the Phreaks' courthouse attack during Arc 6 (the "Sideshow" arc). During that crisis, Sam Small saved Maggie's life from a collapsing building, an act Maggie would later cite as the foundational reason she pursued superheroism. Maggie's powers manifested as semispherical repulsion force fields emanating from her palms and the soles of her feet.

Maggie first appeared as an unknown costumed figure during a South Philly patrol in September 2024, where Sam and Rampart encountered her operating under the name Flashpoint. Sam recognized Maggie as the person she had rescued during the Phreaks' attack and agreed to take her on as a mentee, arranging to train her and eventually patrol together. From that point forward, Sam served as Maggie's primary mentor, teaching her self-defense techniques, power integration in combat, and the practical realities of vigilante life.

Maggie comes from a lower-middle-class Irish Catholic family in South Philadelphia. Her parents, Mr. and Mrs. O'Brien, are strict and have grounded her multiple times for participating in superhero activities. The O'Briens have at times blamed Sam for being a negative influence on their daughter, leading to heated confrontations between the two families after incidents such as Maggie's arrest during a patrol in Kensington. Despite parental opposition, Maggie has remained committed to her role as a hero and became a core member of the Auditors, Sam's independent team operating out of the Tacony Music Hall (later the Tacony Community Center).

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Semispherical Force Field Generation — Creates semispherical repulsion force fields that emanate from her palms and the soles of her feet, totaling up to four fields at once. These fields project concussive force outward in a hemispherical pattern from the point of origin.
  • Hoverskating — Uses the force fields from her feet to lift herself off the ground and propel herself through the air, allowing a form of low-altitude flight or rapid skating movement across surfaces.
  • Projectile Acceleration — Channels force fields to launch objects at high velocity. Can project baseballs at speeds of 100-110 mph and fire loose materials such as gravel like shrapnel.
  • Spiking — Can concentrate all the energy from all four fields into a single field for a momentary burst of amplified force, significantly increasing the output of one field at the expense of the others.
  • Defensive Shielding — Employs force fields as protective barriers to block incoming attacks, deflect projectiles, and shield allies from environmental hazards such as chemical traps.
  • Structural Manipulation — Uses focused force field energy to break mechanisms such as locks, enabling entry into secured locations.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Maggie is a baseline human outside of her force field abilities; she lacks enhanced durability, regeneration, or any secondary physical enhancements.
  • She has been seriously injured in the field, including being shot multiple times during the zoo battle in Arc 8, surviving only because she was wearing Sam's bulletproof vest.
  • The "spiking" technique sacrifices the output of all other fields to concentrate into one, leaving her temporarily exposed.
  • Specific upper limits of force field durability and sustained output are not documented.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Trained in basic self-defense and combat techniques by Sam Small, including judo and boxing fundamentals.
  • Learned to integrate her force fields into hand-to-hand combat through regular training sessions with Sam.
  • Received practical field training through patrols and missions with the Auditors, gaining real-world experience in surveillance, reconnaissance, and team coordination.
  • Knowledgeable about the Superhero Juvenile Safety Act (SJSA) and the legal protections afforded to minor metahumans, which she explained to Sam after their arrest.
  • Serves as a peer mentor to younger powered individuals through the community center mentorship program alongside Sam.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Maggie is energetic, optimistic, and enthusiastic, often speaking quickly and expressively with frequent exclamations. She brings a persistent positivity to the team that contrasts with the more hardened or cynical attitudes of her teammates. She is deeply loyal to Sam and views her as a mentor figure, despite the narrow age gap between them. Her admiration for Sam is grounded not in hero worship but in genuine gratitude for being saved and a sincere belief in Sam's mission.

Beneath her eager exterior, Maggie possesses a streak of moral seriousness that emerges in critical moments. She has confronted Sam directly about reckless behavior and hypocrisy, invoking Liberty Belle's legacy and her own experience of being shot to argue that sacrifice must carry meaning rather than serve as self-destruction. She drew an ultimatum demanding Sam operate as a team captain and strategist rather than a lone field operative, citing the example of Father Mike's teaching that sacrifice must mean something. While somewhat naive and prone to absorbing bad habits from Sam, Maggie demonstrates growing maturity and the willingness to challenge authority figures she respects when she believes they are wrong.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Sam Small (Bloodhound) Mentor / Leader Sam saved Maggie during the Phreaks' courthouse attack. Sam trained Maggie, patrols with her, and brought her into the Auditors. Maggie is deeply loyal but willing to confront Sam about reckless behavior. Mr. and Mrs. O'Brien Parents Strict parents who have grounded Maggie multiple times for superhero activities. Have blamed Sam for being a negative influence.
