docs.title: Rodney Greene
docs.text: Superman-archetype member of the Delaware Valley Defenders, Philadelphia's premiere registered superhuman team, whose electromagnetic field manipulation makes him one of the most powerful heroes in the region.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Rodney Greene Aliases Captain Plasma Date of Birth Unknown Age 30s Gender Male Ethnicity Unknown Place of Birth Unknown Residence Philadelphia, PA (formerly); currently on federally sponsored tour (Los Angeles as of early 2026) Affiliation Delaware Valley Defenders (DVD) Former Affiliations N/A Occupation Registered Superhuman Entity (federal employee) Status Active First Appearance Chapter 113 Last Appearance Chapter 178

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Rodney Greene, operating under the codename Captain Plasma, is a senior member of the Delaware Valley Defenders, Philadelphia's only registered superhuman team prior to the formation of Argus Corps. As a registered superhuman entity, Greene is a federal employee whose identity is public record and who operates with legal protections equivalent to those of law enforcement officers. His role within the DVD has centered on rapid response, hostile metahuman engagement, and high-profile security operations, where his extraordinary power level makes him the team's most formidable combatant.

Greene's most significant field operation prior to his departure from Philadelphia was the prison transport of Kingdom of Keys operatives Mr. Nothing and Mudslide on March 13, 2025. Commanding a convoy from the Philadelphia Industrial Correctional Center along the Pennsylvania Turnpike, Greene coordinated with federal agents Cryptid, Basilisk, and Peregrine to execute the transfer using decoy convoys and aerial surveillance. When the Kingdom launched an orchestrated ambush involving Mr. Tyrannosaur, Mrs. Fulcrum, Mr. Yellowjacket, and Mrs. Jellyjam, Greene fought to defend the convoy single-handedly, ultimately ordering his team to retreat while he held the line. He was incapacitated from behind when Mrs. Jellyjam (operating under the alias "Pink Suit") suffocated him with a gelatinous substance, leading to severe pneumonia that sidelined him for weeks.

Following his recovery, Greene returned to active duty at DVD headquarters, where he continued to serve as a benchmark for the team's younger members. In late June or early July 2025, shortly before departing Philadelphia on a federally sponsored tour to combat the nationwide Jump and Fly crime wave, he sparred with Sam Small in a training exercise arranged by Multiplex. Greene departed first for New York and subsequently traveled to multiple cities, eventually reaching Los Angeles, where he remained as of early 2026.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Electromagnetic Field Manipulation — Greene generates and manipulates electromagnetic fields as the basis for all of his combat abilities. The field extends only millimeters from his skin but provides comprehensive, near-total protection. This single unified power source produces multiple effects that collectively place him at the top of the regional power hierarchy.
  • Near-Invulnerability — His electromagnetic field repels any conductive material within approximately two inches of his body. Physical strikes against him result in electrical discharge that stings the attacker. The field provides protection against conventional weapons, blunt force, and most metahuman attacks.
  • Superhuman Strength — Electromagnetic field manipulation augments his physical output to superhuman levels. He struck Mr. Tyrannosaur at supersonic speed during the Philadelphia Zoo battle, demonstrating force far beyond baseline human capability.
  • Flight — Achieves flight through electromagnetic interaction with the Earth's magnetic field. Capable of sustained, high-speed aerial movement.
  • Superhuman Speed — Moves at speeds sufficient to close distances almost instantaneously in combat, as demonstrated by his supersonic arrival at the zoo.
  • Voluntary Field Deactivation — Can consciously power down his electromagnetic field for situations involving sensitive electronics or when concern for another person's safety overrides defensive posture. This deactivation leaves him physically vulnerable.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• The electromagnetic field extends only millimeters from Greene's skin, meaning it does not project outward as a barrier or shield for others. Its protection is exclusively self-contained.
  • The field can be bypassed by non-conductive or unconventional attack vectors. Mrs. Jellyjam's gelatinous substance circumvented the field entirely by suffocating him rather than striking him, demonstrating that the field does not protect against all threat types.
  • Inhaling foreign substances while the field is active remains a critical vulnerability; the pneumonia caused by Mrs. Jellyjam's attack required an extended recovery period.
  • His voluntary deactivation of the field, while a display of character, creates exploitable openings. Sam Small demonstrated this during their sparring match by feigning injury to trigger his concern, then striking him when his defenses dropped.
  • Despite his power level being described as around the "Alexandria" or "realistic Superman" tier, he does not operate at universe-scale threat levels. His capabilities, while extraordinary, are bounded within a regional scope.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Experienced in coordinating multi-asset security operations, including decoy convoys, aerial surveillance, and anti-ESP countermeasures. During the RG.1 prison transport, he planned the main convoy to take I-78 from Allentown to avoid populated areas while deploying multiple decoy convoys on other highways.
  • Trained in direct superhuman combat, with extensive field experience against high-tier metahuman opponents such as Mr. Tyrannosaur.
  • Possesses tactical awareness sufficient to lead convoy defense operations and coordinate with federal agents across multiple agencies.
  • Has undercover operation experience, though at least one such mission went poorly enough that he shared it as a cautionary tale with the Young Defenders.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Greene is unfailingly polite, optimistic, and projects an air of calm authority in every interaction. He speaks with gentle reasoning and measured tones, approaching both allies and adversaries with a default posture of earnest helpfulness. This altruism extends to a sometimes patronizing need to assist everyone around him, a trait that manifests as paternalistic concern rather than condescension in intent but can read as the latter in practice. He prioritizes the greater good over personal desires to a fault, exemplified by his willingness to order his entire convoy team to flee while he faced the Kingdom ambush alone.

His institutional orientation places him squarely on the side of systems, process, and sanctioned authority. He represents the established approach to superheroism -- federal employment, public identity, legal frameworks -- that Sam Small grows increasingly skeptical of as the story progresses. Despite this philosophical divide, Greene demonstrates genuine warmth toward the younger heroes he works alongside, tacitly approving Sam and Rampart's unofficial patrol by asking them to bring back a "turkey sub" (which Sam corrects to "hoagie"), and acknowledging Sam's cleverness after she outmaneuvered him in their sparring match. He balances institutional discipline with a practical understanding that rigid adherence to rules does not always serve justice.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Sam Small (Bloodhound) Colleague / Senior figure Greene serves as one of several DVD members who interact with Sam in an authoritative capacity. Their sparring match in Chapter 178 demonstrated the vast power gap between them but also Greene's respect for Sam's resourcefulness. He represents the institutional superheroism Sam is increasingly at odds with. Multiplex (Elijah Brooks) Teammate / DVD leadership Fellow senior DVD member. Multiplex arranged the sparring match between Greene and Sam as a teaching exercise before Greene's departure. Fury Forge (Bianca Agnelli) Teammate Collaborated during field operations including the zoo battle and the debriefing of Sam and Rampart after their unauthorized patrol. Rampart (Jason Reynolds) Colleague / Junior member Greene supervised Rampart during his time at DVD headquarters. Tacitly approved Sam and Rampart's off-books patrol. Crossroads (Maxwell Martinez) Teammate Fellow DVD member. Both were present during Sam's hospital interview after the school arson. Bulwark (Kwame Adjei) Teammate Fellow DVD member who served alongside Greene at headquarters meetings and operations. Cryptid Operations partner Federal agent who coordinated with Greene during the prison transport. Texted Greene about journalist presence at the staging site. Basilisk Operations partner Federal agent who maintained anti-ESP field during the prison transport convoy. Peregrine Operations partner Aerial surveillance operative who engaged Mr. Yellowjacket during the convoy ambush while Greene fought Mr. Tyrannosaur. Mrs. Jellyjam Antagonist Kingdom of Keys operative who incapacitated Greene during the prison transport by suffocating him with a gelatinous substance, causing pneumonia that sidelined him for weeks. Mr. Tyrannosaur Antagonist Kingdom operative whom Greene fought during both the prison transport and the Philadelphia Zoo battle. During the convoy ambush, Tyrannosaur escaped via steam transformation. Mrs. Fulcrum (Ballerina) Antagonist Kingdom operative who revealed her power to flip vehicles during the convoy ambush, using both convoy and friendly vehicles as weapons. Mr. Yellowjacket (Motorcycle Guy) Antagonist Kingdom operative who conducted precision attacks on the convoy with bursts of pressurized air. Greene deduced the nature of his attacks during the ambush.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 7: Security Supporting Listed among the Delaware Valley Defenders at the post-homecoming-dance meeting in Chapter 113, where the team discusses the aftermath of Patriot's attack on Sam and prepares for congressional testimony on superhuman regulation. Book 8: Big Supporting Interrupts the Young Defenders' planning session in Chapter 123 to share a cautionary tale about his own failed undercover mission before Sam's Crescent nightclub operation. Present at DVD headquarters in Chapter 125 when Sam reports intelligence from the nightclub. Tacitly approves Sam and Rampart's unofficial patrol in Chapter 127 by requesting a "turkey sub." Debriefs Sam and Rampart in Chapter 128 alongside Fury Forge after their unauthorized confrontation with Jump-dealing gang members, expressing concern about possible mind control tied to Rogue Wave. Arrives at the Philadelphia Zoo at supersonic speed in Chapter 133, striking Mr. Tyrannosaur and leading the DVD reinforcements that turn the tide of the battle. Book 9: Sheol Supporting Present at Jefferson-Frankford Hospital in Chapter 145 alongside Multiplex and Crossroads to interview Sam after Aaron McKinley sets her on fire at school. The trio conducts an official DVD inquiry into the incident, after which Sam requests a private conversation with Crossroads. Book 10: Plume Interlude POV Serves as the point-of-view character in Interlude RG.1, beginning at 2:30 AM on March 13, 2025 when he wakes in a motel room. He deflects questions from reporters (including Janine from the Philadelphia Inquirer) at PICC before conducting a team briefing. Coordinates the convoy with federal agents Cryptid, Basilisk (maintaining an anti-ESP field), and Peregrine (aerial surveillance) using decoy routes via I-78 from Allentown to avoid populated areas. The Kingdom ambush unfolds in waves: first Mr. Tyrannosaur emerges on the highway while Mr. Yellowjacket (Motorcycle Guy) conducts precision attacks with pressurized air bursts; then Mrs. Jellyjam (Pink Suit) hijacks a convoy truck revealing Mrs. Fulcrum (Ballerina) and a rogue SWAT agent (later revealed as Mrs. Doppelganger). Greene deduces the motorcycle attacks are pressurized air, not explosions. Mrs. Fulcrum reveals her power to flip vehicles. Greene orders his team to retreat and attempts solo defense of the convoy. Mrs. Jellyjam ambushes him from behind, suffocating him with a gelatinous substance, rendering him unconscious. Subsequently develops pneumonia from inhaling the substance. Referenced in the arc synopsis as a significant failure that enables the Kingdom's liberation of both prisoners. Book 11: Alarm Will Sound Mentioned Referenced as recovering from pneumonia. His absence from active duty contributes to the DVD's reduced operational capacity during the period of escalating Jump and Fly activity. Book 12: Authorized Personnel Only Supporting Appears in Chapter 178 at DVD headquarters in civilian clothes, visiting before his departure for New York on a federally sponsored assignment. Spars with Sam in a training exercise arranged by Multiplex, demonstrating the vast power gap between them as Sam's attacks fail to penetrate his electromagnetic field. Deactivates his field out of concern when Sam feigns a reopened gunshot wound, allowing Sam to land a punch that draws blood. Acknowledges Sam's cleverness and departs Philadelphia for New York, beginning his multi-city tour to combat the Jump and Fly crime wave. Referenced in the arc synopsis as the benchmark against which Sam's tactical growth is measured. Book 13: Burn After Reading Mentioned Referenced in arc synopsis material. Absent from Philadelphia, continuing his federally sponsored tour. Book 14: Shelter in Place Mentioned Referenced in arc synopsis material. His continued absence from Philadelphia is noted as part of the broader depletion of experienced DVD personnel. Book 15: Severe Weather Warning Mentioned Referenced in arc synopsis material. Remains on federally sponsored tour, now in Los Angeles. Book 16: Category Five Hurricane Mentioned Still on his federally sponsored tour, currently stationed in Los Angeles. His absence from Philadelphia persists as the city faces escalating threats from Songbird and the Kingdom of Keys.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Greene's interlude is designated RG.1, making him one of the few non-protagonist characters to receive a dedicated point-of-view chapter.
  • During their sparring match, Sam discovered that Greene's electromagnetic field repels conductive material within two inches of his body, causing electrical discharge on contact -- a detail Greene explained openly, suggesting he does not consider the information a tactical vulnerability.
  • Greene asked Sam and Rampart to bring him a "turkey sub" when tacitly approving their unauthorized patrol, prompting Sam to correct him with the Philadelphia term "hoagie," a small cultural detail that suggests Greene may not be a Philadelphia native.
  • His codename "Captain Plasma" aligns with his electromagnetic power set, as plasma is the fourth state of matter associated with ionized gas and electromagnetic fields.
  • The character reference guide describes him as being at the "Alexandria / realistic Superman tier," placing him among the most powerful heroes in the story's setting while clarifying that no characters in the world operate at universe-scale threat levels.
  • His pneumonia recovery arc parallels the broader theme of institutional superheroism's fragility -- even the most powerful hero on the team can be sidelined by a single creative attack that exploits an unconventional vulnerability.
  • During the RG.1 convoy operation, Greene woke at 2:30 AM in a motel room, establishing the unglamorous reality of high-security superhero logistics work.
  • He demonstrated analytical prowess during the ambush by correctly deducing that Mr. Yellowjacket's attacks were pressurized air bursts rather than explosions, identifying a pattern in the seemingly invisible blasts.

docs.title: Rosa Acosta
docs.text: Young Latina force field user and defensive specialist of the Tacony Titans, serving as the team's emotional core and moral compass.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Rosa Acosta Aliases Bubble Date of Birth Unknown Age 15 Gender Female Ethnicity Latina Place of Birth Unknown (likely Philadelphia, PA) Residence Tacony, Philadelphia, PA Affiliation Tacony Titans Former Affiliations N/A Occupation Student, Vigilante Status Active First Appearance Chapter 70 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Rosa Acosta is a fifteen-year-old metahuman who operates under the codename Bubble as the defensive specialist of the Tacony Titans, a team of young vigilante heroes based in the Tacony neighborhood of Northeast Philadelphia. She is distinguished by her pink-dyed hair and her ability to generate protective force fields of varying sizes. The circumstances of her power activation are not documented, but by the time the Auditors first encountered the Tacony Titans in late April 2024, Rosa was already an established member of the team operating alongside Sundial, Compass, Moonshot, and Sandman.

Rosa comes from what is described as a stable, middle-class household with loving but permissive parents who support her superhero activities. This stands in marked contrast to many of her peers in the Philadelphia vigilante community, whose families either oppose or are unaware of their costumed lives. Her parents' acceptance has allowed Rosa to participate openly in the Titans' operations without the familial friction that characterizes teammates on other squads.

The Tacony Titans were first mentioned as a local superhero team early in the story's timeline, when Sam Small's friend Lilly referenced them as a group her father had encountered. The team later became a significant part of the broader vigilante coalition in Philadelphia, with Rosa serving as one of its most recognizable members due to her distinctive abilities and personality.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Force Field Generation (Bubbles) — Creates protective force fields of varying sizes, described as rainbow-colored translucent constructs. These "bubbles" can be deployed around people, objects, or areas to serve as defensive barriers against physical threats, projectiles, and environmental hazards.
  • Selective Impermeability — Her bubbles can be made selectively impermeable to air, allowing Rosa to suffocate or trap targets within an enclosed field while still permitting other matter through, or conversely to create sealed environments that protect occupants from toxic gases or atmospheric threats.
  • Trapping and Transport — Can encase individuals or objects within bubbles to immobilize them or carry them from one location to another, functioning as both a restraint mechanism and a means of protected conveyance.
  • Shielding — Deploys force fields as stationary or mobile shields to protect allies during combat, covering downed teammates and providing cover against armed attackers.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Specific upper limits of bubble durability, size range, and the maximum number of simultaneous fields Rosa can maintain are not documented.
  • Rosa is a baseline human outside of her force field abilities; she lacks enhanced durability, regeneration, or physical augmentations.
  • At age fifteen, she is the youngest member of the Tacony Titans and one of the youngest active vigilantes in the Philadelphia hero community, with comparatively limited combat experience.
  • Her force fields appear to require active concentration, meaning she must choose between offensive and defensive deployments in rapidly changing situations.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Trained in team-based combat tactics through her work with the Tacony Titans, operating under Sundial's strategic leadership.
  • Experienced in coordinated operations involving multiple vigilante teams, having participated in joint missions with the Auditors and Team Mayfly.
  • Skilled in defensive positioning and ally protection, consistently deployed as the team's shield and extraction specialist during combat scenarios.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Rosa is bubbly, compassionate, and idealistic, embodying the optimism that her codename suggests. She serves as the emotional core of the Tacony Titans, bringing warmth and positivity to a team composed of more pragmatic and reserved personalities. She is always looking for ways to help others and consistently pushes for peaceful resolutions to conflicts when possible. Her teammates rely on her not only for defensive support in the field but for the morale and cohesion she brings to the group dynamic.

Despite her youth, Rosa demonstrates genuine courage under fire. During the Dobson Mills warehouse battle, she attempted to shield the injured Sundial from attackers and, after being ordered to flee, returned from a catwalk to assist the combined hero teams. She has expressed strong opinions about threats in her community, including a notable dislike of the independent vigilante initially known as "the mosquito" (later revealed to be Miss Mayfly). Her role as the team's moral compass means she advocates for the ethical course of action even when more expedient alternatives are available.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Lucy King (Sundial) Team Leader Sundial leads the Tacony Titans and directs Rosa in the field. Rosa follows Sundial's tactical commands, including orders to retreat during dangerous situations. Joshua Clark (Sandman) Teammate Second-in-command of the Titans. Rosa operates alongside Sandman in team deployments and joint operations. Natasha Sokolov (Compass) Teammate Fellow Titan. Compass considered moving operations underground after anti-vigilante measures intensified, reflecting the team's shared vulnerability. Min-ji Kim (Moonshot) Teammate The Titans' bruiser and eldest member. Rosa and Moonshot complement each other tactically, with Rosa providing defense while Moonshot provides offense. Sam Small (Bloodhound) Ally Leader of the Auditors. Sam's team operates as the aggressive counterpart to the Titans' defensive approach. During the Dobson Mills battle, Sam helped defend Rosa and Sundial, and ordered Rosa to safety. Jordan Westwood (Safeguard) Ally Auditor member. Participated in joint operations alongside Rosa during the Dobson Mills warehouse confrontation.

A basic website listing the team's members (including Bubble) is viewed by Sam and her friends. Sam and Jordan encounter her creating rainbow-colored force fields. She is formally introduced as a member of the Tacony Titans. Rosa expresses dislike of a mysterious antagonist called "the mosquito." In Chapter 73, the Titans assist during the battle with Ricochet. During the Dobson Mills warehouse battle in Chapter 81, Rosa attempts to protect the injured Sundial, is ordered to flee, but returns from a catwalk to provide temporary assistance. In Chapter 82, the Titans help devise a cover story to protect Kate's vigilante identity. In Chapter 83, Rosa participates in the three-team meeting at the Tacony Music Hall to plan Sparkplug's capture. In Chapter 85, Bubble reports on the Titans' investigation findings during a combined meeting of the DVD, Young Defenders, and Tacony Titans to discuss the Rogue Wave threat. Book 12: Authorized Personnel Only Mentioned Sundial visits the Auditors to report that Bubble was caught by police while on patrol, highlighting the escalating anti-vigilante climate under Patriot's "Safer Streets Initiative" offering $500 rewards for reporting powered youth. Sundial contacts the Auditors requesting help with neighborhood coverage as all Titans — Moonshot, Sandman, Compass, and Bubble — are stretched thin dealing with the storm's aftermath and the fifteen coordinated Kingdom break-ins it concealed.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Rosa's codename "Bubble" and her described personality as "bubbly" form a deliberate thematic pairing between her powers and her temperament.
  • She is the youngest member of the Tacony Titans, with the next youngest being Sandman at eighteen.
  • The Tacony Titans are described in the character reference guide as "the boy scouts of Tacony" and the "defensive, reactive" counterpart to the Auditors' "aggressive, proactive" approach — a dynamic Rosa's shield-oriented powers embody perfectly.
  • An early roster of the Tacony Titans listed in Chapter 17 included a member called "Weave" who does not appear in the team's later composition, suggesting a roster change between the team's early days and their on-page introduction.
  • Rosa's force fields are described as rainbow-colored during her first appearance at Wissinoming Park.
  • Her arrest by police during an anti-vigilante crackdown in Arc 12 became a catalyst for strategic discussions among the Titans about whether to go underground or stand down entirely.

docs.title: Samantha "Sam" Small
docs.text: The protagonist and first-person narrator of Chum, a Jewish teenager from Mayfair, Philadelphia who gained shark-based metahuman abilities after a boating accident at age fourteen and became the vigilante Bloodhound, later retiring the identity and adopting the alias Miss Megalodon.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Samantha Small Aliases Bloodhound (retired), Remora (temporary cover identity), Miss Megalodon (current identity) Date of Birth April 16, 2009 Age 14–17 Gender Female Ethnicity Ashkenazi Jewish (paternal) and Hispanic (maternal, via the Blanc family) Place of Birth Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Residence Mayfair, Philadelphia, PA (Small family home) Affiliation Auditors (Leader), Tacony Community Center (Associate Program Coordinator) Former Affiliations Young Defenders Occupation Student (Tacony Charter Academy High School), EMT Intern, Vigilante, Peer Mentor Status Active (as Miss Megalodon) First Appearance Chapter 1 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Samantha Small was a fourteen-year-old Jewish girl living in Mayfair, Philadelphia when a boating accident in August 2023 triggered her Activation Event, granting her a suite of shark-derived metahuman abilities including enhanced bite force, blood-sensing, accelerated regeneration, and the capacity to grow teeth from any part of her body. The accident occurred on Pop-Pop Moe's boat; during the event, Sam transformed into what Morris later described as a "snarling beast of the sea, like an angry marlin," destroying the boat's engine. Sam has no memory of the transformation itself. Sam was subsequently registered through the JLUMA (Juvenile Licensed Use of Metahuman Abilities) system, which brought her to the attention of Diane Williams, the veteran superhero Liberty Belle, who recruited Sam into the Young Defenders program and became her first mentor.

Sam's early career as the vigilante Bloodhound was defined by a rapid and brutal education in the realities of superhuman conflict in Philadelphia. Within her first year of activity, she witnessed a murder committed by the Kingdom of Keys criminal organization, had her family home destroyed by Mr. T-Rex, was tortured by the pyrokinetic Aaron McKinley (who removed her fingernails), watched Liberty Belle die in her arms after a confrontation with Chernobyl, and fell into a radiation-induced coma after pursuing Chernobyl alone into the subway tunnels beneath Philadelphia. She was hospitalized for weeks during Arc 4.5, during which she was formally diagnosed with bipolar disorder, PTSD, ADHD, and autism, and began treatment with lithium and other medications. She also discovered during this period that her mother Rachel's maiden name was Blanc and that she had Hispanic heritage through her maternal grandmother Camilla, whom she met for the first time.

Following her hospitalization, Sam's approach to vigilantism evolved from impulsive direct action toward strategic leadership. She co-founded the Auditors with Jordan Westwood, an independent investigation team operating out of the Tacony Music Hall, dedicated to exposing and dismantling the Kingdom of Keys. Over the course of the next two years, Sam led the Auditors through an escalating series of conflicts involving the Kingdom, the power-drug distribution network Rogue Wave, the government-sanctioned Argus Corps, and multiple individual antagonists including the white supremacist Shrike and the returning Aaron McKinley. She navigated anti-vigilante legislation pushed by Councilwoman Maya Richardson, negotiated a protection arrangement with Rogue Wave to safeguard her family, and mentored a new generation of powered youth through a community center program established by Councilman Jamal Davis.

Sam retired the Bloodhound identity following a near-fatal confrontation with Niles Nolan (Shrike) in late September 2025, during which she manifested complete Instant Armor for the first time and killed Shrike in a dissociative episode. She passed the Bloodhound mantle to Derek Taylor, who became Bloodhound II. After months of attempted retirement spent working as an EMT intern and running the mentorship program at the Tacony Community Center, Sam acknowledged that she had never truly stopped doing vigilante work and adopted the new identity of Miss Megalodon in February 2026. As of the beginning of Arc 17, she operates in Mayfair under this new alias while continuing her roles as peer mentor, EMT trainee, and de facto intelligence coordinator for Philadelphia's independent hero community.

Sam is the daughter of Benjamin Small, a city planner, and Rachel Small (nee Blanc), a librarian. Her paternal grandfather Morris "Pop-pop Moe" Small is a retired engineer with historical connections to the construction of Daedalus Correctional Facility and to Liberty Belle. Her maternal grandfather Victor Blanc is an estranged, emotionally detached figure whose unexpected visit to Philadelphia revealed troubling parallels between his personality and Sam's own tendencies. She has no siblings. She stands five feet ten inches tall and has been described as having a broad-shouldered, wide-hipped, rectangular "powerlifter" build.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text:
Field Value Classification G4/B/C Category Gigant (primary), Brain (secondary), Create (tertiary) Power Ranking 4/10 Control 5/10 Hostility 6/10 Collateral Damage 2/10 Threat Level 5/10

Sam's powers are classified under three PERKS categories. Her primary classification is Gigant, reflecting her enhanced physical attributes (bite force, durability, regeneration). Her secondary classification is Brain, covering her blood-sensing abilities. Her tertiary classification is Create, reflecting her ability to generate teeth from her body. Her overall power ranking is relatively modest compared to heavy hitters like Captain Plasma, but her threat level is elevated by her tactical intelligence, pain tolerance, and willingness to sustain injuries that would incapacitate other combatants.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text:
• Enhanced Bite Force — Sam possesses a bite force dramatically exceeding human norms, consistent with shark-derived physiology. She can bite through materials including flesh, bone, and some industrial materials. This is her most reliable offensive capability in close-quarters combat.
  • Blood Sense — A sensory ability allowing Sam to detect and identify blood within a significant radius. She can sense the presence of blood on objects, identify whether a person is bleeding internally, detect drugs or foreign substances in a person's bloodstream, and assess injuries with diagnostic precision that has impressed medical professionals. This ability functions as her primary investigative and medical tool and is categorized under the Brain PERKS classification.
  • Accelerated Regeneration — Sam heals from injuries at a dramatically accelerated rate compared to baseline humans. She has recovered from crushed tracheas, severe puncture wounds, extensive burns, broken bones, smoke inhalation, gunshot wounds, and cardiac arrest. Her regeneration requires high-calorie, high-protein nutritional support and is not instantaneous; severe injuries still require days to weeks of recovery. Dr. Song has noted that Sam's regeneration has produced "small benign tumors" alongside scar tissue and evidence of chronic organ damage from repeated severe trauma. Her regeneration philosophy is central to her approach to heroism: because she can heal from injuries that would permanently disable or kill others, she views absorbing damage and offering mercy as a moral obligation rather than recklessness.
  • Tooth Generation (Odontogenesis) — Sam can grow teeth from any surface of her body. She discovered this ability during her torture by Aaron McKinley in Arc 4, when teeth grew from her gums and jaw in a stress response. She has since developed multiple tactical applications:
  • Instant Armor — Growing a layer of teeth across her knuckles, forearms, or other body parts to create improvised armor and weapon surfaces. During the Shrike confrontation, she manifested complete Instant Armor covering her entire body for the first time, though this triggered a claustrophobic response and dissociative episode due to its similarity to her initial Activation Event (being trapped underwater).
  • Blading — Growing a single tooth through her forearm and using it as a concealed cutting implement, useful for misdirection and feigning injury.
  • Tooth-Knuckles — Growing teeth from her knuckles to enhance striking damage, her most commonly used offensive application of the ability.
  • Biting Surfaces — Growing teeth on forearms and other contact points during grappling to tear at opponents.
  • Enhanced Durability — While not invulnerable, Sam demonstrates physical toughness exceeding baseline humans. Her jaw can absorb punches with minimal effect (a reflexive lockjaw response), and she has sustained extraordinary cumulative damage across her career without permanent disability, though Dr. Song has warned of possible long-term consequences.
  • Equilibrium State — Sam discovered during her fugitive operations in Arc 15 that she can sustain physical activity indefinitely once reaching an equilibrium between exertion and her regenerative capabilities, allowing extended operations without the normal fatigue experienced by baseline humans.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Sam's regeneration is not instantaneous and severe injuries require significant recovery time; a crushed trachea, severe puncture wounds, and leg damage from the Shrike fight required weeks to months of recovery with medical intervention including external fixators and biopolymer scaffolding.
  • Her regeneration may have long-term health consequences; Dr. Song has noted small benign tumors, chronic organ damage, and extensive scar tissue, and has warned that regeneration might accelerate cancer rather than prevent it.
  • The complete Instant Armor covering her full body triggers claustrophobia rooted in her original Activation Event (drowning), causing dissociative episodes and loss of conscious control.
  • Tooth generation requires significant physical effort, which Sam has described as extremely strenuous.
  • She experienced withdrawal symptoms (headaches, tremors, uncontrollable shaking) after using Hypeman, a power-enhancing drug she injected to survive being shot multiple times during the Soot deception operation in Arc 11. Cigarettes partially alleviated these symptoms, and she subsequently struggled with nicotine use.
  • Her blood sense, while powerful, can be overwhelming in environments with large amounts of blood or many injured individuals.
  • She is a baseline-weight human in terms of mass and can be physically overpowered by opponents with superior strength, size, or weaponry despite her regeneration.
  • Sam takes lithium, Concerta (methylphenidate), Zofran (as needed), Prazosin, and Desvenlafaxine for her bipolar disorder, ADHD, and PTSD. Disruption of her medication regimen affects her cognitive function and emotional regulation.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Boxing — Sam's primary martial art, trained extensively by Multiplex (Elijah Brooks) of the Delaware Valley Defenders. She progressed from fundamentals to advanced techniques over the course of multiple training arcs and now teaches boxing to her teammates and mentees.
  • Aikido — Supplementary martial arts training.
  • Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu — Supplementary grappling training.
  • Dirty Fighting — Sam fights pragmatically and without adherence to any code of honor in combat. She uses deception, environmental manipulation, and psychological tactics freely.
  • Emergency Medical Training — Sam works as an EMT intern and has demonstrated diagnostic abilities that impressed hospital residents, combining her blood sense with formal medical knowledge to identify internal injuries without imaging equipment.
  • Investigative Skills — Inherited Liberty Belle's detective files and equipment, and developed her own investigative methodology combining surveillance, informant networks, and strategic intelligence distribution. Capable of lockpicking (improved from 40 seconds to 18 seconds during her fugitive operations), undercover work, and evidence documentation.
  • Strategic Leadership — Evolved from impulsive field operative to team leader and intelligence coordinator. Coordinates multiple vigilante teams (Auditors, Tacony Titans, Pattinson's Pals) and institutional allies (DVD, FBI, Councilman Davis) as an information hub.
  • Territorial Mapping — Studies city planning maps, sewer plans, and infrastructure overlays to memorize patrol routes, sight lines, choke points, and escape routes throughout Mayfair and Tacony.
  • PR and Media Strategy — Developed an understanding of public relations warfare, deliberately using media coverage and official records (FOIA-able police reports, bystander video) as weapons against opponents. Notably allowed herself to be beaten by Songbird operatives to generate sympathetic public footage.
  • Peer Mentorship — Runs training sessions for powered youth, teaching power control exercises, grounding techniques, safety protocols, and de-escalation strategies.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Sam is energetic, self-deprecating, and impulsive, with a moral compass that bends but does not break under extraordinary pressure. Her narration features stream-of-consciousness thoughts, parenthetical asides, and a distinctive blend of teenage vernacular with unexpectedly sharp observations. She possesses what has been described as an overwhelming "truth drive," a compulsive need to uncover and expose concealed information that she articulates through the phrase "if it can be destroyed by the truth it deserves to be destroyed by the truth," though she lacks the political sophistication to fully appreciate the complexity of that principle. She is deeply funny in a self-lacerating way, frequently undercutting moments of genuine heroism or vulnerability with dark humor. In combat, she uses humor as a deliberate weapon, not in the vein of lighthearted quipping, but as targeted bullying designed to make opponents angry and sloppy.

Beneath the wisecracking exterior, Sam carries the accumulated weight of extraordinary trauma for someone her age. By seventeen, she has been tortured, burned alive, shot multiple times, set on fire, arrested, made a fugitive, and killed a man. She has watched her mentor die in her arms, had her home destroyed, suffered cardiac arrest, and been diagnosed with bipolar disorder, PTSD, ADHD, and autism. Her relationship with danger is paradoxical: she is not suicidal, but she is an adrenaline junkie whose overwhelming lust for life (what might be termed an overwhelming Eros) manifests as seemingly self-destructive behavior. She gravitates toward bad situations for the physiological rush of surviving them. Her regeneration enables and reinforces this pattern; because she heals from injuries that would permanently disable others, she treats her body as expendable in service of protecting people who cannot recover as she can. Her core philosophical position is that regeneration creates an ethical obligation to absorb harm on behalf of others and to offer mercy repeatedly, even when it does not work, because most people only get to make the mistake of showing mercy to the wrong person once.

Sam's mental health is a persistent thread throughout the narrative. Her bipolar disorder manifests in identifiable patterns that she has learned to self-monitor, including flagging potential hypomanic episodes and questioning whether her elevated mood is genuine or symptomatic. She takes her medication consistently and has voluntarily requested therapy on multiple occasions, including asking her parents to schedule sessions with Dr. Desai after recognizing her own deteriorating mental state. She experiences dissociative episodes, hypervigilance, stress-related hair-pulling, and difficulty sleeping. Her ADHD contributes to her stream-of-consciousness processing style, and her autism manifests in her intense focus, pattern recognition, and occasional difficulty with social conventions. She uses cigarettes to manage what she initially attributed to stress but later understood as Hypeman withdrawal symptoms, though her mother established strict conditions around this habit after revealing that Sam's maternal grandmother died of lung cancer.

Sam's relationships are defined by fierce protectiveness and an inability to delegate risk. She struggles profoundly with allowing others to face danger on her behalf, a pattern rooted in the self-reliance philosophy she inherited from her father (who inherited it from Pop-pop Moe, who inherited it from his Holocaust-survivor wife Leah). Family therapy with Dr. Kaplan identified that Sam's vigilantism and her father's gun ownership both stem from the same philosophical conviction that institutional systems cannot be trusted to protect the people you love. Multiple authority figures and peers have confronted Sam about her self-sacrificial tendencies, including Maggie (who delivered an ultimatum demanding Sam operate as strategist rather than lone field operative), Mrs. Patterson (who challenged her to build a sustainable career rather than burning out by twenty-five), and Maxwell (who observed that Sam's "retirement" simply meant doing the same work alone, without backup, and worse). The turning point came in Book 16 when Sam had a breakdown in a Faraday cage during a therapy session, confronting the reality that her "retirement" was a fiction. Maxwell's diagnosis — that Sam had built a "load-bearing life" where stepping back would cause everything to collapse — prompted her to seek a sustainable model rather than oscillating between burnout and compulsion. Sam's gradual acceptance that she cannot personally be present for every crisis, and that systems she builds can function without her, represents one of the central arcs of her character development.

docs.title: Relationships
docs.text: Character Relationship Notes Benjamin Small Father City planner. Protective but increasingly supportive of Sam's activities within negotiated boundaries. Intervened with a firearm during the Rush Order confrontation, becoming the viral sensation "Gun Dad." Teaches Sam about responsible use of power through gun safety lessons and his philosophy of systemic protection through urban planning. Rachel Small (nee Blanc) Mother Librarian. Initially fearful and controlling, Rachel evolved into a formidable political organizer, leading a coalition of parents with powered children that defeated Richardson's anti-vigilante legislation at the state level. Serves as an investigative asset through her coalition work and community connections. Morris "Pop-pop Moe" Small Paternal Grandfather Retired engineer with historical connections to Daedalus Correctional Facility and Liberty Belle. His philosophy of self-reliance, inherited from his Holocaust-survivor wife Leah, permeates the Small family's worldview. Revealed to have complex moral ambiguity regarding his engineering work on Daedalus. Victor Blanc Maternal Grandfather Rachel's estranged father, an emotionally detached figure whose stroke-altered personality creates disturbing parallels with Sam's own tendencies. His unexpected visit to Philadelphia was arranged by the Kingdom as psychological warfare against the Small family. Camilla Blanc Maternal Grandmother Sam met Camilla for the first time during her hospitalization in Arc 4.5, learning of her Hispanic heritage through the Blanc family. Jordan Westwood (Safeguard) Best Friend / Co-Founder Non-binary teen with space-warping powers. Initially an adversary before becoming Sam's closest friend and co-founder of the Auditors. Departed for MIT on a full scholarship, transferring Auditors leadership to Sam. Continues to provide remote technical and research support. Kate Smith / Kay Smith (Soot / Miss Mayfly) Childhood Best Friend Sam's oldest friend, who independently became the vigilante Miss Mayfly and later Soot. Kate harbors romantic and sexual feelings for Sam which she confessed but does not act on. Sam orchestrated an elaborate operation to fake Kate's death and relocate her to Center City under a new identity. Their relationship is defined by deep emotional intensity, class tension, and a subtext-laden physicality expressed through fighting rather than romance. Diane Williams (Liberty Belle) Mentor (Deceased) The veteran superhero who recruited Sam into the Young Defenders. Her death in Sam's arms during the Chernobyl confrontation in Arc 3 remains one of the defining events of Sam's life. Sam inherited Belle's detective files, equipment, and legacy, along with her enemies. Sam has explicitly rejected becoming "another Liberty Belle" in how she mentors younger heroes. Magdalene "Maggie" O'Brien (Flashpoint) Protegee / Teammate Sam saved Maggie during the Phreaks courthouse attack and subsequently mentored her. Maggie is Sam's most loyal teammate and one of the few people willing to confront Sam about reckless behavior. Their dynamic mirrors Sam's earlier relationship with Liberty Belle, though Sam is conscious of not repeating Belle's mistakes. Aaron McKinley (The Coyote) Nemesis Pyrokinetic who tortured Sam by removing her fingernails in Arc 4 and later stalked her during the Sheol arc. Sam has confronted and defeated Aaron twice, sustaining severe injuries each time. Aaron received a 38-year sentence at Daedalus Correctional Facility. The psychological scars of his torture persist as a recurring trauma response. Niles Nolan (Shrike) Antagonist (Deceased) White supremacist Daedalus escapee who targeted Sam as Liberty Belle's successor with explicitly anti-Semitic motivations. Sam killed Shrike in a dissociative episode during their final confrontation, an event that precipitated her retirement from the Bloodhound identity. Derek Taylor (Bloodhound II) Ally / Successor Werewolf vigilante Sam met in trauma support group. Curmudgeonly and antisocial, Derek became a reliable ally during the Aaron McKinley and Jump investigations. Sam passed the Bloodhound identity to Derek after her retirement. He operates publicly as Bloodhound II while trialing the superpower suppressant drug Vysera. Elijah Brooks (Multiplex) Combat Trainer Delaware Valley Defenders member who became Sam's primary boxing instructor and combat mentor following Liberty Belle's death. Their relationship is defined by Multiplex's strict discipline and Sam's impatient drive to improve. Jamila Fayad (Gale/Zephyr) Ex-Girlfriend Sam's first romantic relationship. Jamila left the Young Defenders and broke up with Sam due to her inability to tolerate the escalating violence. She relocated to Chicago and joined the Chicago Powered Youth Initiative. Lily Chen (Blink) Teammate / Friend Auditors member who housed Sam after her home was destroyed. Loyal and good-natured, Lily has proven herself capable of handling crises independently, which helped Sam accept that her team can function without her personal presence. Amelia Li (Gossamer) Teammate / Quartermaster Auditors equipment specialist who designs and maintains the team's costumes and gear. Created Sam's Bloodhound suit, Remora disguise, and Megalodon costume. Possesses a hidden talent with bullwhips and textile-based anomalous weapons. Tasha Reynolds (Lighthouse) Teammate / Childhood Friend One of Sam's oldest friends and the Auditors' intelligence and communications specialist. Practical and blunt, Tasha provides civilian medical support and strategic counsel. Suffered a dislocated shoulder during the Garbage Day attack on the Music Hall. Maya Richardson (Mrs. Zenith) Primary Antagonist Kingdom of Keys-connected City Councilwoman who introduced anti-vigilante legislation, formed Argus Corps, orchestrated a frame-up against Sam using the shapeshifter Elena Morales, and used weather manipulation powers to facilitate Kingdom operations. Sam has systematically worked to expose Richardson's corruption through investigative journalism, political coalition-building, and covert operations. Maxwell Martinez (Crossroads) Ally / Advisor Young adult DVD member with precognitive abilities who serves as Sam's Socratic-method therapist and strategic advisor. Recovering from an assassination attempt by Mrs. Heartbeat, he has been living in the Small family home while providing dispatching and intelligence support. Jamal Davis Political Ally City Councilman who proposed converting the Tacony Music Hall into a community center and established the powered youth mentorship program that Sam leads. Provides political cover, resources, and institutional legitimacy for Sam's activities. Lawrence Sullivan (Monkey Business) Complicated Rogue Wave leader with supernatural contract-binding abilities. Sam negotiated a protection arrangement with him to safeguard her family from Shrike, sealed by mixing their blood. She subsequently fulfilled the debt by tipping off Rogue Wave about Kingdom operations. Joshua Pleasants (Miasma) Secret Ally A mole within Argus Corps and former ally of Liberty Belle who provided Sam with safehouses during her fugitive period and helped orchestrate the capture of Elena Morales. His relationship with Sam echoes and contrasts his earlier relationship with Belle. Alex Kirby (Hellhound) Mentee Sixteen-year-old with pyrogenesis, one of four initial mentorship program students. Romantically interested in Sam (rejected gracefully on Valentine's Day). Conducted an unauthorized solo raid on a Kingdom warehouse against Sam's wishes, reflecting Sam's own tendency toward unilateral action. Now training parkour with Sam weekly. Zara Khan Mentee Mentorship program student improving at algebra. One of Sam's success stories in structured normalcy. Liam O'Connor Mentee Mentorship program student making progress in socialization. Jasmine Walker Mentee Mentorship program student with chlorokinesis (plants within 1-2 blocks respond to her fear). Power is growing faster than her control. Sam promised to help her develop conscious direction. Dr. Desai Therapist Sam's therapist, who monitors for hypomania alongside Megalodon outings. Helped Sam develop the "load-bearing life" framework and reality-testing approach to her self-destructive patterns. Sam voluntarily requested sessions after recognizing her own deteriorating mental state. Dean Carver (Rush Order) Complicated Ally Rogue Wave speedster with passive aerokinesis and homing sense. Ongoing unlikely alliance with Sam since Book 12. Provided intelligence about Maya not being in Harrisburg, contributing to the shapeshifter discovery. Warning texts before Kingdom attacks. Marathon Tactical Ally (Book 16) Rogue Wave operative who conducted joint Bellwether reconnaissance with Sam in Book 16. Their inadvertent collaboration produced the arc's biggest concrete result (federal raid). Sam protects Marathon's involvement. Gerald Caldwell Lawyer Secured Sam's release during the frame-up crisis in Book 15, negotiating a plea deal and ankle monitor arrangement. Sam's legal counsel. Mrs. Patterson Community Mentor Tacony Community Center director who challenged Sam to build a sustainable career rather than burning out by twenty-five. Her sustainability challenge is a recurring motivational thread.

docs.title: Arc Appearances
docs.text: Book Role Key Events Book 1: Pup Main Sam's boating accident triggers her Activation Event, granting shark-based powers. She is registered through JLUMA and recruited by Liberty Belle into the Young Defenders. She discovers her enhanced bite force and blood-sensing abilities through a series of early encounters. She witnesses a Kingdom of Keys murder at a warehouse, an event that catalyzes her commitment to vigilantism. She meets Jordan Westwood for the first time under adversarial circumstances that evolve into a foundational friendship. Book 2: Keys Main Sam investigates the Kingdom of Keys alongside Jordan, establishing their vigilante partnership operating from the Tacony Music Hall. She conducts an undercover operation at the Crescent nightclub and confronts Kingdom operatives including the Coyotes and Aaron McKinley. Her family home in Mayfair is destroyed by Mr. T-Rex in retaliation for her interference. Sam moves in with Lily Chen's family in Bridesburg while her house is rebuilt. Book 3: Dybbuk Main Living with Lily's family, Sam begins dating Jamila Fayad and is introduced to the Philly Phreaks conflict. Liberty Belle intensifies Sam's training regimen in preparation for escalating threats. The arc culminates in Liberty Belle's death at the hands of Chernobyl (Illya Fedorov), which Sam witnesses firsthand. Belle dies in Sam's arms, an event that fundamentally reshapes Sam's identity and sense of purpose as a hero. Book 4: Exorcism Main Sam inherits Liberty Belle's detective files and equipment, using them to form the Auditors with Jordan. She is captured and tortured by Aaron McKinley, who removes her fingernails, during which she discovers her tooth-generation ability under extreme stress. She pursues Chernobyl alone into the subway tunnels beneath Philadelphia, sustaining massive radiation exposure that puts her into a coma. The arc establishes Sam's pattern of self-sacrificial escalation when those she cares about are threatened. Intermission 4.5: Amnion Main Sam recovers in the hospital from radiation-induced injuries sustained during the Chernobyl confrontation. She is formally diagnosed with bipolar disorder, PTSD, ADHD, and autism, and begins treatment with lithium. She meets her maternal grandmother Camilla for the first time, learning of her Hispanic heritage through the Blanc family. She celebrates her fifteenth birthday in the hospital. The arc's title symbolizes her protected healing environment and marks a symbolic rebirth. She is discharged on her birthday and begins planning her return to vigilante activities. Book 5: Mayfly Main Sam returns to active duty, training with Gossamer and resuming patrols with Jordan from the renovated Tacony Music Hall. She encounters the power-enhancing drugs Jump (temporary) and Fly (permanent) being distributed through Philadelphia, and investigates the distribution network alongside Derek Taylor, who reveals his werewolf abilities. Sam discovers that her childhood best friend Kate Smith has secretly become the vigilante Miss Mayfly. The combined efforts of three vigilante teams lead to the capture of distributor Sparkplug, who reveals the existence of Rogue Wave. The arc concludes with a physically and emotionally brutal confrontation between Sam and Kate at their childhood basketball court, exposing class tensions and feelings of abandonment. Book 6: Sideshow Main Recruited as key witness by prosecutor Anne-Marie Gibson for Illya Fedorov (Chernobyl)'s criminal trial; underwent weeks of deposition preparation and survived a grueling cross-examination. Broke up with Jamila, who revealed she may be asexual and could not reconcile with superhero violence; spiraled into depression, showing up at Fury Forge's apartment at 1 AM and throwing herself into reckless late-night sparring with Rampart. Discovered a man undergoing a horrific Jump mutation in Love Park and fought Pumice in a brutal hand-to-hand engagement using knuckle-spike teeth. Testified on Day 4 of the trial; under cross-examination, confronted a handwritten note allegedly from Liberty Belle. Refused NSRA suppression orders at the courthouse protest alongside Playback. Underwent a rage-fueled physical transformation (denticle plates, bone blades, throat barbs) and defeated Deathgirl in a savage one-on-one fight on the courthouse steps, pinning and restraining her. Led search and rescue efforts using blood sense. Received a call from her father expressing pride in her for the first time. Began sophomore year September 5, 2024 amid riot police and metal detectors. Invited to speak at a congressional legislative session. Book 7: Security Main Returns to Tacony Charter Academy for sophomore year on September 5, 2024, amid heightened security and racial tensions. Intervenes when Officer Ridley assaults a Black freshman named James, throwing Ridley with an Aikido technique and receiving a week of detention. Infiltrates Patty's Bar with Jordan on September 13, discovering the school security guards' connection to Patriot and Egalitarian. Co-creates an anonymous whistleblower website with Jordan, Derek, and Spindle, which goes viral. Mentors Flashpoint (Maggie O'Brien) in Aikido and repulsion field combat, discovering her hovering and projectile abilities. Chased by Zero (a power negator) and his Pattinson's Pals followers during a training session with Maggie; escapes to the Tacony Music Hall. At Rosh Hashanah dinner, learns Pop-Pop Moe's firm helped build Daedalus; cousin Abigail deduces Sam's identity as Bloodhound. Watches Illya Fedorov sentenced to fifty years at Aurora Springs. Conducts weeks of surveillance on Patriot's organization with the proto-Auditors. At the homecoming dance, steps between Patriot and Jordan; Patriot brutally beats her in front of the school, breaking her nose and cracking her ribs. A "Spartacus" moment erupts as students and teachers shield Sam and Jordan; Jordan escapes. Hospitalized and returns to school battered. Attends a full DVD meeting and announces her congressional testimony. Travels to Washington, D.C. and testifies as Bloodhound before a Senate oversight committee, advocating for independent oversight of superhuman regulation. Experiences a panic attack during testimony but pushes through. Receives Project Titan intelligence from Devonte and Akilah identifying Patriot as an original test subject and war criminal, along with physical evidence of Egalitarian's Fly use. Confronts Patriot at a Dilworth Park protest, engaging in a philosophical exchange about power and ideology. On Halloween night, fights Patriot in an abandoned warehouse at Penn Treaty Park, having prepared the environment with tripwires, a light killswitch (Tasha operates remotely), pig blood spray, pepper spray, and a gauntlet rigged with syringes. Sustains a broken wrist, dislocated shoulder, and cracked ribs; breaks Patriot's nose twice and bites his collarbone. When her helmet shatters, Patriot recognizes her as Sam Small. Bluffs him with a "poison" injection (actually saline) and negotiates a mutual non-aggression pact: Patriot stands down, leaves Jordan alone, and stays in South Philly, or Sam releases the evidence and exposes Egalitarian's Fly use to DA Alvarez (also a bluff). Provides a first aid kit as a final gesture of mercy. Book 8: Big Main Sam and Jordan attempt to prevent Maya Richardson's election to City Council by exposing her Kingdom connections, but Richardson wins with 81 percent of the vote. Sam conducts an undercover operation at the Crescent nightclub, discovering evidence of coordinated Kingdom activities but sustaining a gunshot wound when recognized. The arc culminates in a complex operation at the Philadelphia Zoo where the Kingdom uses a hostage situation as misdirection to steal poison dart frogs. Sam and Maggie capture Mr. Nothing and Mudslide, but Mrs. Heartbeat escapes with the frogs. Maggie is shot but survives thanks to Sam's bulletproof vest. Book 9: Sheol Main Aaron McKinley returns to Philadelphia, launching a campaign of arson and psychological warfare against Sam. She tracks him using Derek's enhanced sense of smell, discovering he has been stalking locations she frequents. Sam is set on fire during a school evacuation. Kate's house burns down under ambiguous circumstances. Sam confronts Aaron in a final battle near Vogt Park, defeating him but sustaining extensive injuries including burns, broken bones, and a concussion. Aaron is arrested and later sentenced to 38 years at Daedalus. The arc reveals the evolution of Aaron's fire-control abilities and establishes the community's complicated response to serial arson through civilian defense patrols. Book 10: Plume Main Sam provides testimony in Aaron McKinley's arson trial while forming the Auditors as a formal independent investigation team. She encounters the mysterious vigilante Soot and develops a tentative alliance. The Auditors infiltrate a Rogue Wave distribution event at a marina, discovering Monkey Business's supernatural contract-binding abilities. Rogue Wave hijacks television and emergency alert systems to broadcast their manifesto. Richardson forms Argus Corps as a government-sanctioned hero team. The arc culminates in the Auditors' infiltration of the Stheno Pharmaceuticals warehouse, which ends in a chaotic three-way battle and the warehouse's destruction. Sam turns sixteen during this arc and is arrested alongside Maggie during a patrol. Book 11: Alarm Will Sound Main Sam confronts Kate about being Soot and receives Kate's confession of romantic feelings, religious guilt, and the traumatic visions that accompanied her power activation. Sam negotiates with Kingdom leader Mr. Antithesis, providing strategically falsified information about Kate in exchange for two Hypeman autoinjectors. She executes an elaborate deception to fake Soot's death, impersonating Kate while her team poses as a villain group. Mrs. Quiet shoots Sam multiple times, and she survives only by injecting Hypeman to boost her regeneration while submerged in the Delaware River. Kate relocates to Center City. Jordan departs for MIT, transferring Auditors leadership to Sam. Sam develops the Instant Armor combat technique. Book 12: Authorized Personnel Only Main Sam adjusts to leading the Auditors alone, training with Multiplex and teaching combat techniques to her remaining teammates while struggling with Hypeman withdrawal symptoms. She confronts Rogue Wave operatives at an abandoned Sunoco station, encountering Marathon, Dead Drop, and Rush Order. Richardson directly threatens Rachel at her library workplace, which galvanizes the Small family into coordinated resistance. Sam is ambushed by Rush Order in a staged public confrontation; her father Ben intervenes with a firearm, wounding Rush Order and becoming the viral sensation "Gun Dad." Sam confronts Richardson at a town hall, where Rachel reveals the parent coalition in a coordinated protest. The arc concludes with the Small family establishing new boundaries acknowledging they cannot stop Sam's activities but negotiating conditions. Book 13: Burn After Reading Main Sam discovers the Morrison Collection of superhuman historical materials and proposes adding Liberty Belle's notebooks. The Daedalus prison break releases approximately fifty prisoners, including Shrike. Sam's maternal grandfather Victor Blanc arrives in Philadelphia, arranged by the Kingdom as psychological warfare. Shrike begins hunting Sam with explicitly anti-Semitic motivations, escalating from dead birds to a home invasion. Rachel's coalition defeats Richardson's anti-vigilante legislation at the state senate 11-9. The Kingdom is revealed to be subordinate to the international mercenary group Red Calf, led by Porcelain. The arc concludes with the Small family fleeing their home. Book 14: Shelter in Place Main Sam negotiates a protection arrangement with Rogue Wave through Derek's connection to Elias, sealed by mixing blood with Monkey Business. She discovers Shrike is using the Metropolitan Opera House as his base and sets up a confrontation at the Van Kirk construction site. The battle with Shrike and his skinhead followers proves nearly lethal. Sam manifests complete Instant Armor for the first time, experiences a dissociative episode, and kills Shrike. She is hospitalized with a crushed trachea, severe puncture wounds, and leg damage requiring an external fixator. Sam retires the Bloodhound identity and passes it to Derek. Councilman Davis proposes converting the Music Hall into a community center. Sam begins the peer mentorship program with Zara Khan, Liam O'Connor, Alex Kirby, and Jasmine Walker. She experiences cardiac arrest for 23 seconds during a Jumphead incident while working as an EMT. The Kingdom attacks the Music Hall through the enforcer Garbage Day, injuring Tasha, but Tasha plants a tracker on the attacker. Book 15: Severe Weather Warning Main Sam tips off Rogue Wave about Kingdom evidence disposal, fulfilling her debt and resulting in nineteen arrests including Mr. Polygraph. Richardson retaliates by deploying the shapeshifter Elena Morales to impersonate Sam as Bloodhound, generating an arrest warrant. Sam goes underground as a fugitive, conducting eleven days of systematic raids against Kingdom operations with Crossroads providing intelligence. She compiles evidence and feeds it to the Philadelphia Inquirer and CapeWatch Philly. She confronts Elena at Maya's address, proving two physical bodies exist simultaneously. Gerald Caldwell secures Sam's release with an ankle monitor. Maya uses weather manipulation to generate a targeted blizzard facilitating Kingdom break-ins. Sam and Amelia, disguised as "Remora" and "Stingray," capture Elena Morales during a constituent outreach event, obtaining a recorded confession that breaks Maya's alibi machine. Book 16: Category Five Hurricane Main The Tacony Community Center officially opens as Elena's confession hits the news. Sam attends the grand opening wearing the Bloodhound costume symbolically. She receives keys to the center as associate program coordinator. Agent Ford of the FBI establishes Sam as an off-the-books evidence channel. Sam investigates the tainted Jump crisis, mapping the supply chain from street dealers through an auto body shop to a Bellwether District industrial cutting operation. She forms a reluctant alliance with Marathon for joint reconnaissance. She is attacked by a Songbird bounty hunter, realizes her retirement is unsustainable, and adopts the Miss Megalodon identity. She stops a Kingdom false-flag robbery at Donovan's Hardware in her first outing. She deliberately takes a public beating from Songbird operatives for its PR value, generating bystander video evidence while building an official police paper trail.

docs.title: Trivia
docs.text:
• Sam's Activation Event was a near-drowning incident during a boating accident, which is why her complete Instant Armor triggers claustrophobia -- the sensation of being fully enclosed mirrors the feeling of being trapped underwater.
  • She has been described as "probably the strongest seventeen-year-old girl on the planet" in baseline human capability terms, possessing a powerlifter build with broad shoulders and wide hips at five feet ten inches.
  • Sam does not read comics, a detail revealed when Alex Kirby made a Peter Parker comparison and she responded that she does not read comics.
  • Her medication regimen includes lithium, Concerta (methylphenidate), Zofran (as needed), Prazosin, and Desvenlafaxine. She recognized the stimulant adulterant in tainted Jump as Concerta because she takes it herself.
  • Sam's birthday is April 16. She celebrated her fifteenth birthday in the hospital during Arc 4.5 and turned sixteen during Arc 10.
  • The name "Megalodon" was chosen independently by Sam and first spoken aloud to a civilian (Mr. Donovan) during her first outing stopping a false-flag robbery. Her Megalodon costume is blue and white with a shark-shaped polymer helmet featuring a permanent slight grin and a voice modulator that produces a flat, mechanical, almost masculine sound.
  • Sam frames her identity shift from Bloodhound to Megalodon as a mathematical piecewise function -- different functions on the same domain, representing a discontinuity rather than a contradiction.
  • She is Jewish on her father's side (Ashkenazi) and Hispanic on her mother's side (through the Blanc family), though she did not learn about her Hispanic heritage until meeting her grandmother Camilla during Arc 4.5.
  • Sam has killed exactly one person: Niles Nolan (Shrike), during a dissociative episode in which she lost conscious control. Shrike died approximately one hour after being hospitalized.
  • Her approach to mercy is philosophically grounded in her regeneration: because she can survive mistakes that would kill others, she believes she has an obligation to offer mercy repeatedly, even to those who have proven they do not deserve it.
  • Sam uses a "truth drive" philosophy she cannot fully articulate: "if it can be destroyed by the truth it deserves to be destroyed by the truth."
  • The Tacony Community Center was made possible in part because the Garbage Day attack on the Music Hall triggered historical preservation funding that Councilman Davis redirected toward renovation.
  • Multiple characters have noted that Sam is more transparent than she believes herself to be; both Mrs. Patterson and Maxwell Martinez have seen through her strategic calculations in real time.
  • Sam's self-reliance philosophy was traced through four generations of her family in therapy: from Holocaust survivor Leah Small to Pop-pop Moe to Benjamin Small to Sam herself.
  • She initially considered "Shark-girl" as a hero name in Chapter 2 and dismissed it immediately. Her initial reaction to her own powers was that they were "shitty" and mostly gross.
  • Sam keeps her JLUMA in her phone case.
  • The Small family observes Shabbat dinner at Pop-pop Moe's house in Ventnor, New Jersey.

docs.title: Tasha Reynolds
docs.text: Civilian support specialist and intelligence coordinator for the Auditors, operating under the codename Lighthouse.

docs.title: Infobox
docs.text: Field Value Full Name Tasha Reynolds Aliases Lighthouse (Auditors codename), previously operated under an insect-themed codename on Team Mayfly Date of Birth Unknown Age 15–17 Gender Female Ethnicity African-American Place of Birth Unknown (likely Philadelphia, PA) Residence Mayfair, Philadelphia, PA Affiliation The Auditors Former Affiliations Team Mayfly Occupation High School Student, Civilian Support Operative Status Active First Appearance Chapter 3 Last Appearance Ongoing

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Tasha Reynolds is one of Sam Small's closest friends from middle school. She was part of Sam's original friend group alongside Kate Smith, Marcus Johnson, Lilly Rodriguez, and Jenna Nguyen. An intellectual and avid reader, Tasha was described as the group's analytical mind and "mother hen" from early on. Her mother, Natalie Reynolds, is a nurse at Temple Health, and her father, James Reynolds, is an academic. Tasha's upbringing in a medically oriented household fostered her interest in physiology, anatomy, and emergency medicine.

Before joining the Auditors, Tasha was a member of Kate Smith's vigilante outfit known as Team Mayfly, where she served in a technical support capacity. Team Mayfly operated as a non-powered vigilante squad in Northeast Philadelphia, using improvised gadgets, drones, and coordination rather than superhuman abilities. When Sam discovered Team Mayfly's existence and its overlap with her own circle of friends, the team was folded into Sam's operations, with its members restricted to reconnaissance and technical support rather than field combat.

Tasha transitioned into the Auditors as Sam's primary civilian support operative, providing field medicine, logistics, communications monitoring, and intelligence analysis. During the Shrike crisis in late September 2025, she was formally given the codename "Lighthouse" by Sam for her role as the team's communications and surveillance coordinator. She later debuted a custom costume consisting of a concealing blue-and-white outfit, a mechanical arm brace with a phone slot, bundled wires, and a small leashed drone equipped with a red LED light.

In November 2025, Tasha was seriously injured during a Kingdom of Keys attack on the Tacony Music Hall. A Kingdom contractor known as Garbage Day dislocated her shoulder in a calculated act of intimidation. Despite being in severe pain and shock, Tasha demonstrated remarkable composure by secretly planting a BugTag tracker on the attacker during the confrontation, providing the Auditors with critical intelligence on the operative's location. Her shoulder required 4-6 weeks in a sling followed by physical therapy, and as of early 2026 it remains approximately ninety percent healed.

docs.title: PERKS Assessment
docs.text: No official PERKS assessment on file. Tasha Reynolds is a baseline human with no metahuman abilities.

docs.title: Abilities
docs.text: • N/A — Tasha possesses no superhuman powers. Her contributions to the Auditors are entirely skill-based.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• No Superhuman Durability — As a baseline human, Tasha is vulnerable to injury in ways her powered teammates are not. This was demonstrated when Garbage Day deliberately targeted her as the weakest physical link during the Music Hall attack.
  • Non-Combatant — Tasha is not trained for direct combat and relies on her teammates for physical protection during field operations.

docs.title: Training & Skills
docs.text:
• Field medicine and emergency care training, influenced by her mother's nursing career and her own interest in anatomy and physiology.
  • Communications and intelligence coordination, including police scanner monitoring, drone operation, traffic camera surveillance, and radio communications management.
  • Mechanical engineering aptitude, demonstrated by her construction of a custom pepper spray dispenser and her technical contributions to Team Mayfly's gadget arsenal.
  • Research and investigation skills, including property records analysis, social media cross-referencing, and open-source intelligence gathering. Led the Auditors' investigation into the Songbirds, identifying the organization as an astroturfed radicalization pipeline rather than an organic grassroots movement.
  • Drone operation and surveillance, utilizing small drones for overwatch during field operations including the Shrike confrontation and Alex Kirby's warehouse raid.

docs.title: Personality
docs.text:
Tasha is practical, blunt, and deeply loyal. She is often the most cautious voice in any planning discussion, advocating for restraint and risk assessment before committing to action. Once a decision is made, however, she commits fully to supporting her team. She speaks directly with little embellishment and is not afraid to call out her friends, including Sam, when she believes they are being reckless. Her manner has been described as that of a "mother hen," fussing over the physical well-being of those around her.

Beneath her composed and analytical exterior, Tasha privately struggles with self-harm, a fact she conceals by consistently wearing long sleeves and sweaters. Not even Sam was aware of this until the Garbage Day attack, when Sam noticed old scars on Tasha's forearms. Tasha deflected the topic, indicating she was not ready to discuss it. She has a fondness for insects, slugs, and other creatures most people find unsettling. She also possesses a sharp, dry wit and is capable of pointed humor when the situation calls for it.
